description:
I love the vibe of this place! Happy hour 2-7pm. Order at the bar for drinks, $8 for happy hour drinks, and some food.

Not as Topsy's as I thought it was gonna be, but loved the music and vibes.

We had the old fashioned (hubs approved) and the peach perfect (so good!). Happy times! And find josh, he's the best bartender.

We also got the bruschetta (yumski, so good) and the pulled pork sliders (with pickles and potatoes) honestly everything was tasty.

Cheers
author: Mandi T.

description:
Lmao what is it about creepy old guys and tech bros loving this place?

I think it's kind of cute with the clown stuff but let's peel the paint back a bit and really get to brass tacks...

I've been here 5+ times, at all different hours. The food is meh, the drinks are meh, the prices are outrageous. The bartenders are the best quality but let's be honest, they dress slutty and flirt with all the older guys, so I see a lot of after work "regulars" chatting it up with the ladies. 

Consequently the service gets slow when they start chatting it up, and this place gets PACKED after hours, so you can barely hear anything and wait 20 minutes to get someone's attention.

Sorry, but when I get outa work I like peace and quiet when I drink my ass to zen-like states.
author: John W.

description:
I came here in the mid-afternoon after I finished running some errands in the area.

The bar was pretty empty (as expected for that time of day) but there was a couple at the bar.

I ordere an Old Fashioned from the bartender and it was just ok. It seemed like the proportions were off when she made them.

Later a huge group of bro-gramers and were talking about code and whatnot. Needless to say, they ruined the quiet vibe and I down the rest of my cocktail quickly.

I'd give a try at night to see what the crowd is like then.
author: Art O.

description: Low key fun bar with super friendly bartenders!  A shout out to Avery and Ayana for making me great spicy margaritas and being super engaging and interesting in conversation!  Taco Tuesday was delicious and made my first night in town for a conference a quick way to relax and wind down.
author: Michael Y.

description:
I can see why this place is highly rated. I wasn't sure what to expect based on the funky clown/carnival sounding name but all I knew was that I wanted to watch the Cavs vs. Celtics game and have a couple drinks and some bites. Turns out it was a great choice and I'll definitely be back again!

What the place has:
- Bar seating
- Tables and couches for groups
- TVs to watch games
- Nice bartenders 
- Unique bar seats with a spring base so you can bounce around while you wait for your drink
- Solid drinks made with fresh ingredients 
- Average food
- Happy hour
author: Saachi G.

description: Fantastic place for happy hour. Good drinks and food, and fun circus vibe. Highly recommend for a post-work drink, especially if you like unique atmospheres in the financial district.
author: Joel L.

description: Yes! Perfect post work happy hour and Taco Tuesday! Get that Smoky Marg my friends and enjoy!
author: Ella B.

description: Came here on a Wednesday for their happy hour to help me get over the hump. The bartenders are very friendly and we were able to find seats right away. It's a decent size bar with lots of tables and a spacious lounge area for your party. There is a big variety of cocktails on the happy hour menu, so pick your poison! $2 off the cocktails during HH. The prices for food during happy hour range from 6-14. I recommend checking it out if you are in the area. The only downside is there is only one bathroom.
author: Fei Z.

description:
My friend and I were looking for a quick happy hour spot in downtown to kill some time and Topsy's was exactly what we were looking for.

We came on a Tuesday, when they had a special Taco Tuesday menu. Note that they also offer happy hour all day Monday and Tuesday to Friday from 2 - 7 pm. There is a food menu filled with various small bites, but the happy hour deals are primarily for drinks. If you check in on Yelp, they offer half off either the bruschetta or deviled eggs, which we definitely took advantage of :)

In the spirit of taco Tuesday, I ordered their strawberry margarita ($8) along with both the chicken and carnitas tacos. The strawberry margarita was served in a mason jar (very chic) and was very light and refreshing. I liked it so much I ordered a second one. Tacos were decent but not great, but I wouldn't expect a place like this to have amazing food.

There is bar, couch, and table seating inside, but it was a nice day outside, so we decided to sit at one of the two outdoor tables where it was more quiet and conducive to conversation. Music was blaring pretty loudly from the inside of the bar.
author: Dianna H.

description: Fun bar and decor, great happy hour, good food and times! Some of the clientele was a little weird.
author: Mary L.

description: I was in the neighborhood waiting for Pagan Idol to open.  I checked my bookmarks....uh collections (anyone else annoyed bookmarks are now collections?) and saw that Topsy's was right around the corner.  From reviews I was expecting more of a theme.  I didn't notice much of a theme at all.  I ordered a Peach Perfect off the Happy Hour menu.  It was very good.  Bartender was friendly but spent most of her time talking to two guys at the end of the bar.  I really liked the music they were playing.  Seems like it would be a fun place later in the evening when it gets busy.
author: Heather N.

description: We came in for just for a quick drink to place our bags down but ended up staying for more drinks and food because Josh was taking such good care of us at the bar.  He not only gave use efficient service but also helped guide our experience in the right direction.
author: David H.

description: A nice place to seat back and relax and enjoy my double black!
author: Peter Paul L.

description: Thanks to Josh, we had a Topsy Tipsy fun ol' time. Check the photos for evidence. Btw- wings were good.
author: Desirée O.

description: I popped in for happy hour after seeing good Yelp reviews. I stayed for one drink. This isn't the kind of place to just have a drink when it's dead inside. It needs a bustling crowd of revelers. Otherwise it's just a small bar with a strong smell of industrial pine-scented cleanser.  Oh, and they were out of two of the three IPAs listed on tap.
author: Ted S.

description: We came here for HH. The drinks were pretty good and they were a good deal at 8/9 dollars each. We also ordered the margherita pizza and bruschetta. Both were excellent. Service was friendly but you may have to try get their attention if you're sitting at the tables (busy at the bar)
author: Anna J.

description: The drinks are strong and tasty. The devil eggs hit the spot. Come and see Avery the bartender, her drinks are killers, and very friendly
author: Dean N.

description: The bartender was so nice and really took care of us. I could not have imagined better and more energetic service than from our bartender. I think her name is Avery or something?? Idk, she was great. Will come back!!!
author: Sam E.

description: What wonderful deviled eggs! The bartenders are fantastic and happy hour has great vibes.
author: Alex B.

description:
Starting our girls weekend off, three of us met in SF for some drinks before heading to Napa. Topsy's was pretty cool inside. The bar stools are so unique- each one different than the other. There's also a large, taxidermy bear by the bathrooms.

We were the only group of females in there at the time and didn't have many exchanges with the bartender. When we did, they were friendly, short, normal conversations in passing. At one point, we were cracking jokes about age because two of us are Asian and look like we're about 12. It was all good.

We were having a great time and enjoying catching up with one another until this female waitress, who's very apparently in a relationship with one of the bartenders, got weird with my group. She felt the need to 'stake her claim' to this guy and make it a point to force him to coddle her behind the bar while we were waiting to order drinks. Cool.

This waitress snatched my more than half full drink off of the table, asked if I was done, didn't wait for a response and dumped it out behind the bar while staring me down. Even cooler. We left shortly after, because who would want to spend money for service from a miserable person?
author: Amy E.

description:
I've walked by this place a few times and always wanted to check it out. My boyfriend and I came in on a Monday after work. It wasn't too crowded so we were able to grab a seat right away. There is bar seating, high top tables, and a couch along the wall with smaller tables and little stools. It has some funky decor and the place was lively. 

The service was great. When I went to the bar to order the bartender came over and helped me immediately. I ordered the Paloma and it was pretty good. Happy hour lasts all day on Monday's and they have a pretty great deal. Happy hour specialty cocktails are only $8 which is pretty hard to find in this city. They also have some small bites but I didn't see anyone eating.

It's a great spot to grab a few drinks after work. I will definitely be back for happy hour.
author: Taylor F.

description:
I stumbled upon Topsy's by chance and I left feeling like the luckiest man alive. 

Katerina was hosting for the night and she can mix drinks like a DJ mixes records. She cooked me up the California Republic to start which was incredible then followed up with a Topsy - also on point. But it got real when with a twinkle in her eye gave me a rum cocktail that was so good, I needed a cigarette after. (And I don't smoke, yo.) She called it the Pirate's Smile. Appropriate.

It was a slower night so we got a chance to talk drinks, linguistics, and pretty much anything else.  When other folks rolled in, she was quick on the draw making the service and overall experience well worth it. 

I can't strongly suggest enough to swing through if you're in the financial district of SF. You won't regret it.
author: Jon L.

description:
Just as Austin Powers is scared of carnies, "Carnies. Circus folk. Nomads, you know. Smell like cabbage. Small hands," so am I. Lost a star from the get go. 

Yet with Wing-Woman by my side, I was assured things would be all right. Honorably asked at the door for ID, we entered the mysterious cavern of Topsy's. 

A lovely little store with a long bar and a few table tops. The bar stools certainly embrace the name, Topsy. At first I thought it was broken, by no. They just wiggle a bit. 

Ali, an infectious and enthusiastic mixologist poured us up neat shots of Jameson, which leveled out the playing field. The place has the right amount of speakeasy and sophistication, even with a Friday night Millennium crowd   

The bar menu seems decent and a return to the carnie carnival  is definitely in order.
author: David N.

description:
It was Tuesday evening, and I needed a spot to meet a friend for a catch-up drink. I finally found a couple spots, but finally settled with Topsy's.

As I walked in to the place to scope things out, one thing became apparent- it was deafeningly loud. Not only the music, but the crowd inside. It felt like a had to scream in order to communicate to my friend across the table. 

Second related observation- it was extremely crowded. All the seats and tables were occupied. I waited for my date for about 20 minutes, and few spaces opened up. We finally found a table in the front after a few minutes of waiting around.

We ordered a few different drinks: strawberry, smoky, and classic margaritas. Good taste and size for the value. 

The tacos available for Taco Tuesday are carnitas and chicken. There wasn't much taste to the tacos, but I wasn't expecting Farolito.
author: Nicholas G.

description: Randomly stopped in here on my walk down the street but glad I did. Cocktails and bar service were outstanding, do yourself a favor and try the Old Flame - a take on a classic Old Fashioned where Absinth is literally set on fire and included in your cocktail. Charcuterie and the bruschetta were delicious as well.
author: Alex B.

description: Topsy's is great. Randomly walking in here with an out of town friend and we had delicious pizza, veggie sandwich and hummus plate. Fun vibe
author: Jessie J.

description: Amazing friendly bartenders. Cocktails are made well. I love the welcoming warm vibe I got when I walked in. I ordered the deviled egg appetizer and it was done well.
author: Gina C.

description:
Creepy (to me) theme, but delicious drinks.

When I saw there was a lychee martini on the menu, I was completely heck yeah! I was so heck yeah that I convinced another friend to get one too from my sheer enthusiasm alone (more like she was already planning to get it and was embarrassed by my excitement). 

So there we were, three ladies sipping on our martinis/margaritas (the third friend held out and continued her margarita spree) when I noticed the clowns. I am not a horror fan. I saw The Ring three times and I still can't tell you what it's about because I closed my eyes all three times. Now, one may say that clowns aren't scary, but that person is wrong. I find them terrifying when you're in a darkened bar. Maybe at a kids party it's fine, but when you're slightly tipsy the last thing you want to see if a clown head. 

The drinks here are phenomenal, so I don't want to knock this place just because of the clowns. It is definitely a differentiator. (I went to six bars while I was in San Francisco and this one I can still clearly envision). Yet, if you have a phobia of clowns, this isn't the bar for you. If you can tolerate clowns and love yourself a good drink, definitely check this place out.
author: Christina G.

description: Loved our happy hour cocktails- the peach perfect drink was great. The deviled eggs are also a must try!
author: Anjani G.

description: Nice hangout spot for drinks in the city. Decent playlist, loud music for a casual date night vibe. Food right across the street for after drinks! Good bar tending but the drinks were a little pricey, but that's SF for you.
author: Melody C.

description: This place is packed for happy hour!! Their happy consists of $8 select cocktails, definitely can't find this in a lot of other places in the FIDI. Their bar stools are also these cute lil stools that are on this coil that move around lol. I literally work down the block so I'd definitely come back for happy hour in the future. Service is also pretty fast which is always much appreciated at a bar.
author: Cindy F.

description: One of the busiest after work bars in the city.  Always packed, but a good place to grab a drink and watch a game.  Bartenders are very efficient getting drinks served in a timely manner, no matter how busy the bar gets.  They offer a robust Happy Hour menu, but at this time I haven't had a chance to sample any of their food items.  I did notice on my visits however that several of the tables we nibbling on various things, so I'm assuming the food could be tasty.
author: Jeff H.

description:
Ridiculous I got here at the end of the game my first question to the waitress was how much is the beer here? She said $6.71 I asked if they had Belgium she said yes but that one is $9.00 so I said how about Heineken? She said $6.71 so I'm drinking my beer watching the OT Warriors gave her my credit card right away drinking my beer she brings me the check is $12.00 . !!!! 

Idk then I had to get up and talk to the manager because I kept asking for my waitress to come ...
author: Marie Eugenia M.

description:
Such a cute environment - best strawberry marg!

Will definitely come back. Great happy hour!
author: Jaymie C.

description:
Sign me up for another fun time at the fun house! Topsy's Fun House, that is! Topsy's is a cocktail bar nestled on the corner of Kearny and Bush street in the Financial District of San Francisco. Although it's located on the corner, you can't miss it once you hear all of that good music bumpin' as you pass by!

I came here with a group of Yelp friends after leaving Pagan Idol just around the corner. We were looking for somewhere else to continue the party and we stopped by Topsy's. I really feel like fun is an understatement when describing this place! I'm generally not a huge fan of bars in the city, but THIS is a bar that I would happily come back to. The vibe is just extremely attractive! There's a great mix of people who come here and the setup is really chill! There's lots of TV's and high tables for seating. The inside is very narrow, but the bar is long and glorious! It has such a sexy little vibe to it with the lighting and the decor. 

And those DRANKS though? Mm hmm... me likey! Me likey my A LOT! First off... the drinks here LOOK beautiful! You ever gotten a drink and didn't wanna drink it because it looked so puuurdy? Yep... it's like that. I couldn't wait to post my check-in photo the night that I was there (although I accidentally ended up checking into the wrong place! Womp womp). Bee-you-tee-fuuulll! And the best part is, it tasted even better than it looked! Ain't that somethin? Especially for SF, because I'm super biased! I ended up having the California Republic cocktail which consisted of bourbon, aperol, china-china, and lime juice. Not gonna lie... I really don't know what the hell aperol and china-china is, but what I will say is that the bourbon was DEFINITELY apparent! No skimps-r-us in that department boo boo!

And dear Lord... the MUSIC! (Gasp). Let me just take a moment to thank whoever that DJ was! I have a very eclectic taste in music and I appreciate many different genres. However, I also just thoroughly enjoy old school hip hop and slightly ratchet tunes. Yes, that's me... you can judge me all you want, but you know that you secretly bob your head to those ratchet songs in your car too! But, let me just say that when they busted out that old school Regulators track and when they started playing Bone Thugs and Harmony and Ice Cube... it electrified my soul. I felt like I was a kid again and I probably would have been shaking my you know what on top of the table if I had a few more drinks in me. A good thing that didn't happen because I would hate to get kicked out of a nice place like this,  but I digress...

Anyways, moral of the review is: bring your butt down here if you want to have a fun time! I should also mention that this place has an awesome happy hour that I have not yet gotten the chance to partake in. Happy hour is all day on Mondays here and from 2-7 Tuesday through Friday! That's five hours of alcoholic heaven for you! I plan on coming back here again real soon.
author: Shayla B.

description: Awesome bar, great bartender and great conversations to be had. I highly recommend the the 1921 honey
author: Jackson R.

description: I was looking for a place to watch the Stanley Cup final game at and tried out Topsy's. It was pretty empty on a Saturday around 5 except for a few couples getting pre-dinner cocktails. The bartender kindly turned the game on and checked in on me and the game frequently to see how it was going. I ordered a few of the Franziskaner beers and for $6 it was huge! Really enjoyed the beer and the price. The bartender was very friendly and seemed to enjoy making the cocktails and maintaining the bar throughout the night. The decor is fun, circus-chic with a lot of attention to detail. In addition to the bar there are a few high tops near the entrance and a lounge section along the side. By the time I left around 8:30pm it was starting to fill up. Highly recommend stopping by if you're staying in downtown San Francisco. They have a great cocktail list that I would have indulged in if I wasn't planning to spend 3 hours drinking there.
author: Emily B.

description: Fun place! Happy hour ALL DAY on Mondays, which is great, because we stopped in on a Monday!!! Bartender Ana was friendly and helpful! Enjoyed some German beer and deviled eggs with bacon!
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Super fun bar. Love the drinks. Great music. Hard to sit still because I just want to dance. We ordered the bruschetta and sliders....yummy. 

Not too crowded for a Friday Happy Hour spot. Definitely will be back.
author: Pagie P.

description:
The hummus didn't have much flavor, but the bruschetta was good. The drinks were also really tasty 

UPDATE: The cucumber gimlet is just a tad sweet, but still one of the better ones I've had. The lychee martini is also very sweet but pretty good, but I would expect that for this drink, and it's a unique tropical-tasting drink.
author: Elena K.

description: Came here with my friends last weekend. This is a very cool bar with super friendly bartenders, beautiful interior and warm atmosphere. What I really love about this bar is the swinging bar chairs;)  location is great, close to a lot of other fun stuff in the city. Come see yourself!
author: Taisiya P.

description: Great spot, fresh ingredients, and friendly service! We ordered cucumber gimlets and bruschetta. Recommend for a happy hour spot!
author: Laura C.

description: Great place to catch a game or enjoy a happy hour. They have great decor and seating, including several TVs that are big but not too obtrusive. The beer selection is solid and reasonably priced, and they have all of the correct glasses for the various kinds of beer. The happy hour cocktails are also a great deal, and my friend loved his Old Fashioned. There is also a decent selection of bar bites if you're hungry. Overall, this is a surprisingly solid bar for downtown San Francisco - I think I'll come back often!
author: Dale H.

description: The pulled pork quesadilla was outstanding. Good portions, amazing taste! Happy hour drinks great as well. And the bartender Lana was amazing on top of it all! PS You don't want to miss out on these spring loaded barstools! Highly recommend!
author: Maria V.

description:
Solid bar, reasonably good deals (especially for the neighborhood), and a fun atmosphere- though it's really best on taco Tuesday. 

We came here on Thursday once and it was pretty crowded for happy hour. Happy hour drinks at $8 are decent...maybe that price is considered good for fidi, but overall it's only okay. 

But, come back on Taco Tuesday? Then it's a lot more solid. $3 tacos and $8 margaritas honestly still aren't things to brag about, but it brings an expensive neighborhood back to normalish prices. 

They're not the best tacos, and not the best margaritas, but they're one of the best of ways to go out with coworkers without breaking the bank. 

Outdoor seating and the yelp bonus for the free appetizer are nice to boot. 

It's a place I'll maybe come back to now and then for taco Tuesday and happy hour...it benefits from location and a fun atmosphere, even if there's nothing particularly to write home about.
author: Chris S.

description: Anna is the best bartender in the Topsy's . Thank you for the special cocktails :) will come back again 100%
author: Ivan S.

description: Awesome service from Anya. This is our first day visiting SF for business decided to venture out and glad we stumbled across this place. Old Fashions were great and she whipped it up in less then 30 seconds. Kudos. It's customer service like this that not only makes me stop what I'm doing to commend The service via Yelp but also come back the next time I visit SF.
author: Sharri J.

description:
Great place to chill and watch the game. Pouran treated us like straight up royalty. Will be back!

-Divya
author: Divya S.

description: Cool place to get a drink and decent HH deals considering it's the city and the financial district.  The decor really hits the fun house theme, and the bartenders were really nice.  If you're coming for sports, there's 4 TV's, but you might be hard pressed to get a good view since it gets pretty packed quickly.  We were able to find a seat at the bar, but we came pretty early (around 430).
author: Andy V.

description: Awesome atmosphere! Great happy hour. Good food and drinks. What else do you need on a Thursday night.
author: Crystal C.

description: Topsys is the perfect location and eatery in San Francisco for sips and bites! Highly recommend, fun ambiance and great staff!
author: David M.

description: This place is the perfect for catching up with friends and having a good time. The bartenders are hilarious and so nice. Great vibes overall, would recommend to anyone spending time in the city!
author: Shruti S.

description:
Topsy's is a cool little bar in financial district that represents a bit of like being in at a carnival funhouse (hence the name), where they have awesome bar stools that look like springs, studded seats and mirrored walls all around. Even the a part of the ceiling has some toys sticking out which is pretty neat!

I have only been around here for happy hour after work and I've seen it get pretty crowded especially on a thursday or friday. Monday is all day happy hour specials and tues-friday between 5-7pm. This is probably one of the few spots I can think of that has HH up to 7pm which I feel is pretty uncommon in SF. As for their HH cocktails they are $8 select cocktails and $5 house beer. Would recommend their peach perfect, cucumber gimlet or whiskey moscow mule. No food specials unfortunately :( but I have tried their deviled eggs and tomato bruschetta which are pretty good bites to share with someone else.

Downside of this place is when it gets crowded it can get really loud so it might be hard to hear the person next to you.
author: Kathleen S.

description: Great little bar with excellent service! They had an amazing Happy Hour that goes all day / all night on Monday's! And the drinks are definitely quality - I went with the Lychee Martini and was not disappointed! Definitely worth a visit for great drinks and good prices!
author: Courtney W.

description: Came here after work with my coworkers, must say the drinks r so so good! Have had 4 different ones so far and every single one of them tastes great not to mention the bartenders are so attentive! Great vibe and great overall experience
author: Ping L.

description: My friends and I stopped by on a Wednesday afternoon for Happy Hour. We ordered the tatchos, bruschetta, wing Wednesday special, and $8 happy hour drinks. We loved the tatchos! We also enjoyed the music, attentive staff, and tasty drinks. Come here after work sometime, you won't regret it!
author: Natalie O.

description:
Awesome spot for Happy Hour!

Came here for my boyfriend's birthday and had the best drinks from the bartender, Josh: lychee martini, 1921 honey, old fashioned, and topsy's mule 

Staff is friendly and fun, atmosphere is lively, and the drinks are delicious. Will definitely be back soon, and highly recommend.
author: Rebecca L.

description: Cute little spot for a Friday night after work. Definitely recommend it for the drinks.
author: Brenda M.

description: Fun, laid back spot to enjoy some drinks and light food. They have a whiskey Moscow mule ("Topsy Mule") which was awesome and still very refreshing despite being whiskey-based. Happy hour is pretty long... 2-7pm! Service was quick and friendly. On Wednesday they have a chicken wings special which was a good value. Clean bathroom. Honestly nothing to criticize here... it was a bit slow at 4pm but by 5pm on a Wed it had picked up with young professionals,  although there were still a few spots to sit down. I had a good time.
author: Victor B.

description: Great music, delicious cocktails, and very nice staff. Yum  the band was playing classics that are always good to hear when you're on a night out with good friends.
author: Kaelig D.

description: Great vibes,  good drinks - the bartender made us an experimental cocktail to try when we first came in on the house. Great appetizers as well
author: Lizzy W.

description: Loved it! Deviled eggs were the best. Craft cocktail happy hour is hard to find in San Francisco
author: Bronco H.

description:
ordered 3 patron shots. bartender filled shots half way up the plastic shot glasses. (c'mon, give me at least 3/4 worth if the shot is $16 each) she spilled one of the patron shots & didn't clean it up. & instead of pouring a new shot, she poured patron from one of the shot glasses into the empty one. LOL! when she gave me my receipt & credit card back, she was careless enough to place them both over the patron she spilled. she was not nice & she didn't apologize for placing my card into a puddle of alcohol. 

+2 stars for the music
author: Fatima B.

description:
Really great drinks. Especially for a Monday.

Their 1921 honey is a must try. 

Recommend trying out this place!
author: Megha A.

description:
This place is great, i try to come at least once a month since i live in the east bay.  The food is always great, service is fantastic.
Today is Monday and i guess every Monday they have Happy Hour all day. 
Josh was our bartender and he was just awesome. They also had a jazz band playing today. Will be back soon.
author: Rachel G.

description:
Came here after seeing the ridiculous line for Pagan Idol right around the corner and don't regret it! 

I think this place is named the way it is because there are weird "fun house" type things in the ceiling. I looked up after I had had a drink and I have to say it was kinda scary and creepy. Don't look up. 

I had the lychee martini and it was really good. Unique and delicious. 

They also have great music here! It's part of what drew me in. 

Overall a classier bar than I'm used to in SF and I like it! Will be back.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Great environment. Good food. Strong drinks. Fun decorations. What more can you ask for?

This place is a hidden gem in the fidi and atmosphere is awesome. Drinks aren't too expensive and the food is surprisingly good (see picture of quesadilla).

Also, awesome service by Pouran! Super friendly and attentive!
author: Melissa C.

description:
I went to Topsy's yesterday for the first time after it got ringing endorsements for the cucumber gimlet from elena. There were 3 bartenders and the service was pretty good. 

I tried 3 drinks and they were as follows:

Cucumber Gimlet - Surprisingly good. It's hard to find a good gimlet out (usually there's way too much lime). This had the right amount of lime and if anything was a little sweet for my taste. But overall, it was the best gimlet I've had out at a bar. 

Old Fashioned - Nothing to write home about really. Not good or bad. It tasted more like a whisky on the rocks than an old fashioned. I don't mind it. 

Lychee Martini - A little too sweet for me. Couldn't taste any of the alcohol (I suppose most people appreciate that) but just tasted like lychee juice. 

Definitely coming back. Kudos to you for making a drinkable gimlet!
author: Nick D.

description: Yeah. Good times with good people. This is not a bad place for it. I enjoyed the bartender's interaction with us. She wasn't invasive and she wasn't dismissive. Just the right portion, which is important to know for mixing drinks too.
author: Larry L.

description: Ordered a classic old fashioned. Very smooth and original. Love the live music and ambiance of the room. Will be back!
author: Josh B.

description: Great service. Reuben is amazing! His customer service is beyond anything I've encountered in the fidi!
author: Lisa C.

description: Ruben was so amazing! Very good drinks! Come during happy hour and get the 1921 Honey
author: Sammah H.

description: This place get packed, but they have happy hour till 7pm, so get here early if you want a table. They also have outdoor seating which is rare in the financial district. Their happy hour menu is decently priced and offer food as well on happy hour prices. I ordered the lychee martini, it was made well and consistent by two different bartenders.
author: Sandeep C.

description: Amazing cucumber gimlet! Cool environment very nice bartender!!!!!! You should come here for happy hour!!!
author: Carrie T.

description: One of my favorite places to get drinks after work! Delicious and affordable drinks :)
author: Semen K.

description: Was traveling for work and wanted a casual spot to grab food. I came in for the happy hour wings and stayed for an order of hummus and an old fashioned by Pouran the bartender.  Thanks!
author: Lisa W.

description:
Topsy's is a great little gem and such a wonderful surprise. Romantic environment, classic cocktails and talented mixologist's (Anastasia & Ali).


We ordered the Fresh Mozzarella Bruschetta, which was so delicious. We also ordered two cocktails; an Old Fashion (prohibition style) it was perfect, especially for the whisky connoisseur, and the Thirsty First, which was so refreshing. One more thing, They have a great selection of alcohol! You won't be disappointed.
author: Christina P.

description: Great Friday atmosphere, cute bartender Lana. Thank you for another nice evening in Topsy's bar
author: Robert M.

description: What a trippy little place in the financial district area. Great spot to kick off happy hour and a night of laughter. Music is a bit loud when trying to carry on a conversation but its fun. Loved the ceiling art - don't miss it! Bar stools were wildly unique.
author: Kevin K.

description: Two thumbs and two thumb-toes up! Best strawB-Marg I've ever had. Lol.  Will definitely be coming back (don't forget about the devil-eggs)
author: Stephen C.

description:
Fun place to go after work.   I  only stopped by for a drink and was there for about an hour.   There happened to be some Howard Stern Whackpackers having a meetup.  I got to meet High Pitch Eric,  Joey Boots and Gonzo Sh*tcock.  

I got a free hummus appetizer for checking in and shared.   Quite delicious for a  freebee!  

Clean restrooms and parking almost next door but it was pricey!  

Clean restroom.

Awesome friendly servers too!
author: Ruthie V.

description: Topsy has an amazing happy hour to match its playful environment - had the deviled eggs trio on this visit and they were a great snack to compliment my cocktail. Highly recommend coming here for a drink and some good drinks
author: Bobby S.

description:
lol original review deleted* even though i can walk in the door and show you the exact table we were at when chick was trying to play angry but also caressing up on me.

but i can't show you my phone where i texted or called her again. bc i didn't heyyyooooo! like i said #byefelicia

(-_^) BBQ Pulled Pork Sliders $12
(-_^) Chicken Quesadilla $8

they played nonstop motown str8 fire. not a bad place to start a crunktastic voyage of an evening all around town.

*+1 nobu k points; good to know i can keep my team jersey
author: Dan B.

description: Came over to Topsy's after work for HH and was greeted by Pouran ( bartender) with a beautiful smile. She suggested we try the Home Made Hummus with our drinks and the hummus was on point. The ambiance was super chill and a good place to unwind. Great service!!
author: Yoshi S.

description: I've somehow only come here outside of happy hour but enjoyed it nonetheless. First time I came on a Friday night it was PACKED. Really hard to find a place to sit even at the bar. I got the California Republic which was pretty strong and very well-made. The second time I came here was a Saturday night and it was far less crowded than the other time so we managed to get a table. I had the Berry Smash which was just light enough while still packing a decent punch. I'd like to come back for happy hour and to try the food, as well.
author: Pooja C.

description:
So many bars around this area where I work, but I only go here.

Great ambience. Great bartenders who know how to make drinks. Awesome service.

I would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Leonel M.

description:
Great service and happy hour. Food wasn't the best (had the charcuterie board and hummus)

Music is also on point.
author: Laura D.

description:
This place was pretty chill. Boutique style bar, interesting decor. The craft cocktails were good. It had a local click feel to it.
My friend and I are from Denver, so we didn't join in with conversation much. I'm sure if we lived near by we would meet a lot of like minded people.
author: Keri Noel F.

description:
Went back to Topsy's to have a few drinks with friends and to try out the food.  The Pizza, hummus plate, chicken quesadilla, charcuterie plate, and Arugala salad were all very good.  A couple of us had old fashions, one of us had the perfect peach (or something like that), then beers and vodka soda. The mixed drinks are not large, but they were made well.  Old fashions come with the large square ice.  $8 for hh cocktails.  $6 for beers.

We sat at one of the table and the service was a team effort and was very attentive all evening.

It was lively inside, but not too crowded.  The tables are a little small though.

The chicken quesadilla was very good and so was the margarita pizza.  I would order both items again.  The other food items were good as well.  None were typical cheap bar food.  The charcuterie plate came with 4-5 different meats all of which were delicious and there were mini toast and mustard and pickled veggies to go along with it.
author: Ty C.

description: This place is off the chain! Ruben is the shit. If you don't know, now you know!! Bomb old fashioned and Irish mule!! Ruben!!!! In the house!!!!
author: Jezrrella R.

description:
Sometimes you want to go crazy, Sometimes you want to get a little nutz! And that's what it sounds like when you're in "San Francisco" on your "Birthday" about to partake in "Happy Hour" on a "Tuesday" with a fellow Yelper....Yea, it was a an unconventional day to go out for me at least....or was it? We are talking about San Francisco where one of my bartenders said to me.."This is San Francisco, everyday is the weekend here, always expect the unexpected" here is my impression on Topsy's Fun House!

4/19/16
Day two into my vacation and it was my "Birthday" so I was really in the fun and social mood this "Tuesday" and to see what it had in store for me. Thanks to fellow Yelper "Porsche C" for wanting to show me something new, and treating me pretty awesome on my "Birthday" we both met up here at Topsy's and it was perfect timing considering it was "Happy Hour" and being that it was "Tuesday" tacos was on the menu to go with the whole "Tuesday" theme. Okay I know, I said "Tuesday" a lot so far but, I was really impressed with not only SF but this place this "Tuesday" afternoon.

Service - 4/5
Ambience - 4/5
Food and Drinks - 5/5

I waited a bit and then Porsche arrived and it was time to "Go up, on a Tuesday" I had a beer earlier before her arrival, but later had a Topsy Mule from the Happy Hour Menu which was $8.00 that is normally $10.00 off of the Happy Hour. Let me say....it was pretty fantastic, I opted for the vodka mule and it was very well balanced, these bartenders are pretty skilled and not just pouring some heavy drinks that some bars in SF tend to do. I actually enjoyed this drink and can't wait to have another one one day soon. 

On to the food, they have some options available, but on a "Tuesday" I went with the tacos $2.00 which is kinda....a no brainer duhhhhhh! Chicken and Carnitas aka Pork were the protein choices here. We got two of each, and then we took one from each others plate. To be honest, they were very light in taste and they weren't greasy. They matched well with the alcoholic beverages we had during our visit. They weren't like your run of the mill taqueria style tacos, but the taste are still familiar enough to feel down home in a more midscale setting.

The theme is kinda like..I guess you can say a fun house or circus maybe. From the outside it looks kinda like a little posh lounge, and then you enter and be like....okay I see waz up. The barstools are very uncomfortable, they are sitting on some springs and they have no impact whatsoever, so they are very stiff. I totally recommend sitting on the wall booth seating. The service seemed kinda....dry that is till the crowd started to roll in and the staff seemed to get more pumped up. The restroom door wouldn't lock so I was nervious when I had to go that someone would walk in on me. But no one did so I'm good with that.

Would I go back?

I think I would, even if the day wasn't "Tuesday" seeing weekends are usually my options for freetime.

In Conclusion, Topsy's Fun House is in a great area, two bart stations are nearby "Montgomery and Powell" if you're a Bart rider like me. And it seems like the after work crowd enjoyes this place. I would definitely recommend this place for night outs or even a date considering the fun setting. As always if you come, Yelp your own experience!
author: Tre S.

description: My favorite spot in San Francisco ! Good atmosphere , delicious drinks and great service
author: Ana C.

description: Beers were fine, decently priced for SF. Lively place and the service was friendly. But the wings and tater tot appetizers?  Meh. I'd avoid them. The wings were soggy and didn't taste that great. Tater tots were also cold and soggy. That was very disappointing. If you're here for the drinks, you'll have a good time. Just avoid the food.
author: Jo H.

description: Somehow just spent $20 on two WELLS tequila shots, which wouldn't be the worst except for the fact that the shots were 50% sauza silver/ 50% water. Thanks for the hydration?
author: Kelly P.

description: Super fun lively place! Bartender was very helpful and narrowed down the perfect drinks for us. Was supposed to be a quick stop but so good we stayed for a few!  And their in house brew is fantastic. Perfect day drinking beer.  Wish we were here longer so we could revisit.
author: Karen S.

description:
Really? Who would give this place 5 stars! It's a bar, expensive bar food for what you get- 3 deviled egg halves for $6? Really?
We
Went on wing night Wednesday, the wings were small and nothing special, typically priced. Bartender lady was prompt and served fast but When questioned about providing a double- that tasted like water- was argumentative and not helpful. Go elsewhere.
author: Diane A.

description: I wish I could remember our bartender's name because she was great! I asked her if she would be willing to come up with a drink (sans alcohol) for me and she happily obliged without any hesitation. She made something with a citrus flavor for me but I couldn't hear her well enough to be able add it to this review. And to be quite honest, I think I was just happy to be served a virgin drink without being judged for it. ;) The bar is small & cozy and our group had plenty of room to kick back and relax for a bit even for it being a weekend night.
author: Jai J.

description:
All-day Happy Hour on Mondays!

My girlfriends and I decided to come here for some drinks before our dinner reservation. The bartender, Ali, was very friendly and suggested some drinks. I loved the cucumber gimlet and whiskey sour that he made (first time having a whiskey sour, ever). Would definitely come back when I'm visiting again.
author: Lisa N.

description: Yum!  Can I just say, "spicy margarita!"  Delicious.  Cool vibes, relaxed atmosphere with great lighting and music to set the stage for a good time.  Attentive service staff.  Variety of drinks but shoot for a try of that margarita
author: Melissa G.

description: First time here. Just stopped in for a quick beer and see the score of the game before my next event. They didn't have my regular beer but my new good buddy Ali the bartender hooked me up with a great replacement! Wasn't going to eat anything but Ali said I must try the deviled eggs and boy was he right! Excellent with the bacon topping! Yummy!! Ali made the pit stop great!! Very knowledgeable and friendly!
author: Kevin P.

description: Chill place. We immediately got a bar seat on a Friday night which was crazy. Order gin and tonics and the drinks were nice and strong. Loved it.
author: Ashmita V.

description: Solid after work vibe in the greater fidi area. Super friendly/attentive bartenders (Pouran especially), excellent bar bites (I recommend the deviled eggs), and the music was great (90s and modern hip hop).
author: Doug D.

description:
Do you like juice passed for alcoholic cocktails? If so you should check out this place.

Their juices cost around $10-$14. The atmosphere is pretty nice and cosy. They don't have waitresses who walk around take your order or and so if you want a drink you have to climb on the shoulders of whoever is sitting at the bar and wrestle your way to the bartender.

Similarly if you're trying to pay for your tab and leave, you have to wait for the one bartender who is running the show and pray to god that he notices you.

I'll look for other places next time.
author: Sean D.

description: Love this place! Great staff, great food and best of all great drinks. Highly recommend Topsy's. make sure you ask for Ali, he's an unbelievable bartender and will definitely take care of you.
author: ali t.

description:
Great place to unwind for happy hour, especially for Taco Tuesday!

They only have chicken or carnitas at $3 apiece, but their green & orange sauces are delicious - evoking memories of San Diego hot sauce. 

Wash them down with Topsy's craft IPA & you're golden. A little dark inside but sat by the window which gave us light, people watching as well as a good view of the games on TV!
author: Roger D.

description: This bar is so fun! Went with coworkers after work for HH. Pouran was a great server - super attentive and got our drinks/food out quickly. We shared the margherita pizza and it was delicious.
author: Raelle A.

description: Lively bar with a great range of cocktails. Elegant circus theme (not tacky clown) good for after work drinks and also to get a taste of the local life if from out of town. I recommend the spiced Margherita!
author: Daniel M.

description: This is one of the best little bars around - the drinks are fun and inventive, the staff is super friendly and knowledgeable and the atmosphere is chill ;))) my destination on those #hadaharddayatworkneedadrink ;)
author: Zayka Z.

description: loved the ambiance, reminds me of a circus and I couldn't be happier. drinks were amazing, love the bartender!
author: Anyssa D.

description: Service was quick and tasty margies!!  Be sure to take advantage of Taco Tuesday and the great happy hour!
author: Nancy P.

description:
The name speaks for itself!

I love coming down to Topsy's after long day of work. Their music, food, and of course drinks never fail to disappoint. 

What I love is how strong their drinks are. They're always so generous with their alcohol that I keep ordering more. Price is not an issue because their drinks are fairly priced.

Don't be fooled by how small their place is because it's always popping!
author: Denzell S.

description: Never been treated so awfully at a bar before, bartender Svetlana doesn't know how to read out of state driver's licenses... proceeded to bend and attempt to rip my license, please get a machine that can just verify the validity of a license rather than to treat a customer that way. After examining my license, she threw a menu at me and walked away. Seriously? It's moments like these when I'm so disappointed that women can't respect and support one another
author: Virginie C.

description:
Best. Gimlet. EVER. 

Finally checked off one of my Bookmarks by going to Topsy's! A lot smaller than what I expected but I'm honestly not sure if there was more to it than what I saw. There were stairs leading down near the entrance but since we only stopped here for a quick drink before dinner we didn't have time to be nosey.

I had the Cucumber Gimlet and I must have said "Oo this is good" after every sip... (yes I was being annoying). My friend had the whisky mule and it was perfect too. $21 for both which wasn't bad at all for strong drinks in the city. 

Can't wait to go back and experience more "Fun House" vibes next time around. The crowd was a 25+ which is nice. Not that I'm hating on the 21 year olds but when you've had a long day... who has the energy for them? ;)
author: Margarita V.

description: Great place for happy hour right in the heart of FiDi. Good food and fantastic service by Pouran!
author: Rommèl C.

description: I've been a regular at topsys for the last couple of months and it's always a good time. My drink of choice is the 1921 or the Fraziskaner beer which is delicious!! They play a variety of music depending on who is bartending, each bartender great in their own way. Nice lighting not crazy dark and intimate enough to enjoy yourself. Love the place!
author: Yesenia S.

description: Cool environment. Cool beer. Pouran was our waitress and took care of us! Recommend the German wheat because it's a 20oz for $6. They also have happy hour all Monday and Tuesday - Friday where they knock off $2 off the mixed drinks.
author: Min Z.

description: Dive bar with good energy on a Friday evening. Staff was friendly and service was fast. It's not so crowded where you can't find a seat, but not so empty where you don't have anybody to talk to. Nice place to have a drink and relax for a small part of your day.
author: Char L.

description: Tried to happy hour for the first time at Topsy's. Thrilled to find out new go to. Great house cocktails and unique decorations. It's been a while since we've encountered friendly bartenders in SF so this was a nice change. They were all great. The Monkey Business and the Topsy's Mule were amazing!
author: Dora M.

description: Great place to come for happy hour. The bruchetta app we ordered was in perfect proportion and for a group of four it was a great starter. It came with the right amount of balsamic, tomatoes, and garlic...heaven in your mouth. Pouram, our waitress was knowledgeable and helpful with drink/ good selections. I reccomend the Paloma drink, but all the drinks our group ordered looked great.
author: Kacy J.

description:
Fantastic location to have a drink after work. It's pretty busy mid week and they have Taco Tuesday's. I highly suggest trying their spicy margarita. It's quite good. I've been here on multiple occasions and always have a good time. It's probably the cute bartenders. Yeah I'm pretty sure that's why I keep coming back. Does that make me a horrible person? Nah, didn't think so. 

Highly recommended. For a good time call 415-555-5550. Haha!
author: Tim G.

description: Super fun place! Just like its name! Try a peach perfect or lychee martini. :) Def recommend it for happy hour!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
I like to stop here after work with my co-workers. Its conveniently located in FiDi and very close to Bart. 

The waiters were super nice and asked if I needed another drink when my glass was getting empty. 

Drinks: 
Mint Mojito - I think they put a little more alcohol than a usual mint mojito.  

Service: 
-Typical bar service. You order at the bar and the bartender makes your drink 
-space isn't too big so would not recommend for big groups to come and hang out. 
-they have a large projector where they show football/basketball games
author: Amy N.

description: Decor was lovely, servers were darling, drinks were alcoholic. But everything was nice without any "wow" factor.
author: Mackenzie W.

description: Great spot, awesome music and good service. Pouran served us all night and killed it.
author: Robbie S.

description: I came here on a Saturday night for my friend's birthday. Firstly, I love the theme! Circus? Yes please :) It was a great place with friendly and helpful staff and good drinks. While I was there, I had the strawberry basil martini and peach perfect. Also had a taste of the 1921 honey (yum!) and the lychee martini (it was good but not quite to my taste). It wasn't too busy when I was there, but I expect it must have a really good vibe when it's full of people.
author: Bianca C.

description: Great spot for happy hour. Came here for cocktails and appetizers after work. Good atmosphere, cozy seating, and tasty snacks (had the hummus and bruschetta), and friendly service (Pouran was one of our servers). Will definitely be back!
author: Meredith H.

description: I work in the financial district and this is the perfect after work happy hour spot! The food is so good which is unusual for bar food, and the service was great from Pouran! Also they have tv's all over so it's great for sports games as well!!!
author: Kyle K.

description: Came here for a random happy hour, but was pleasantly surprised by their delicious cocktails. Had a paloma, old fashion, and spicy margarita and was impressed by each. Our server Pouran was great too, super nice and a good sense of humor. Enjoyed the margherita pizza as well.
author: Mike L.

description:
Love the place.
Drinks are on point. 
Bartender is a gem. 
This place has good appetizers during the happy hour.
Really cool place to hang out after work
author: Albert B.

description: Came here on a Monday night and they had live jazz playing! Loved that, also the service was great and our drinks were well made.
author: M. U.

description: Awesome place for happy hour, friendly staff, affordable prices, good crowd. Lot of employees of financial district are coming to have good time, so it's also good place for networking:) yeah, they have tacos, really good one with chicken
author: Grigori E.

description: Great happy hour prices! Our server, Pouran, was friendly and attentive. The cocktails and food were delicious. Highly recommend!
author: Jessica M.

description: First time here and the bartender was very friendly! She made me a personal drink because I didn't know what I wanted :) Drink was amazing!
author: Faith P.

description:
If you want to get a little tipsy, ESPECIALLY on a weekday, go to Topsy's Fun House! You won't regret it! I tell myself I won't drink on a weekday, but weekdays are so much better when you are TIPSY AT TOPSYS! In addition to their happy hour every day from 4 to 7: 

+Monday: All Day Happy Hour - 2 dollars off their special cocktails ($8), specials on bar bites and just a great overall crowd. 
+Tuesday: 2 dollars tacos (with guacamole and good amount of protein) and $8 margaritas. 
+Wednesday: 10 dollars for their beer special and 6 wings (lotsa flavor, I usually get the BBQ).

Great craft cocktails, colorful circus theme, upbeat music, and personable/fun dressed bartenders really make Topsy's a great place! Would highly suggest getting the Topsy's special (Egg White, Tequila, Pomegranate), but a lot of the drinks are made with love and bartenders don't mind the feedback!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
I came here for happy hour drinks with the girlfriends and I was surprised about how lively this place was. With an eclectic carnival feel and lots of seating booths this is a great place for happy hour especially if you're coming from FiDi. 

Food: cheese quesadilla; bruschetta; veggie sandwich -3. Nothing to write home to and pizzas weren't available for the night. 

Service: 5- constantly checked on by our server and tables cleaned regularly. Much appreciated. 

Ambiance- 4: definitely a post FiDi crowd with nicer non-hipster dress folks 

Drinks: variety of cocktails but having your own house brewed ale is a plus. A solid 4 for me!

Will definitely come back for another HH. Hopefully can try the pizzas.
author: Linda L.

description: Really awesome place. Nice atmosphere, interactive bar tenders, delicious drinks. Try the Peach Perfect
author: Olivia P.

description:
Just like a fun house, Topsy's is full of amusement. Bouncy seats, drinks and snacks make for a fun happy hour. I met up some friends on Tuesday, August 25th around 6:30pm.

Drinks:
*Old fashioned: Jim beam bourbon, brandied cherry, angostura bitters, orange twist ($8 happy hour, $10 regular)
*Old flame: basil hayden's whiskey, angostura bitters, flame of absinth ($12)

The only thing that interested me on the HH menu was the Old fashioned. It was lighter than I preferred. Tasted a little watered down. The Old flame was fun as they lit it on fire by spraying absinth. Gave it a nice smokiness.

Food:
*Tacos: chicken served with pico de gallo, home made guacamole, shredded lettuce, no chipotle sour cream ($2 ea)
*Roasted tomato bruschetta: basil, parmesan and balsamic reduction ($8)
*Topsy's pizza: home made crust with extra virgin olive oil; Margherita: fresh mozzarella, tomato, basil ($12)

Since it was Tuesday, Topsy's was serving tacos. You can choose from chicken or carnitas. A good taco for $2 since it came with guacamole. I liked the salsa they provided as well. I had one of the bruschettas. I'm not a big sweet and savory person, so I found the balsamic reduction to be a little too sweet. The pizza was good. Crust was soft with a nice chew.

We sat at the bar which was perfect. The bartenders were attentive and entertaining. I had a great time catching up with friends, eating, drinking and just having a fun time.
author: Elena N.

description: I loved how they had live music right at the entrance. The cocktails were also great. I ordered the California republic.
author: Joe B.

description: Good find in San Francisco forr weekdays. Variety of happy hour margaritas are good and cheap!
author: Michael S.

description: Great bar! Very knowledgeable staff, friendly, and full of down to earth people. The girls behind the bar look sharp in their bow ties!
author: Trixie M.

description: All day happy hour on Mondays is genius! Thank you!! Other pros: service, music, big projector for sports
author: Connie L.

description: This place is perfect for happy hour. The go to spot to cap off the week. Make sure you swing by and enjoy the atmosphere!
author: Jay H.

description: Such a fun bar and awesome happy hour drinks! Highly recommend the happy hour drinks, especially the cucumber gimlet. Bartenders are super nice too :)
author: Meghan M.

description: Great drinks, friendly service and funky chairs. Stopped in here between getting my hair done at Cinta and flying out. Check it out!
author: Melissa B.

description: This place is the bomb... Service was excellent by Pouran and the pizza was ecellent. Can't stress enough how good of vibes are at this place
author: Stephen H.

description: This place is SUPER FREAKIN CUTE!!! The drinks were AMAZING ... I had the Berry Smash and my business partner had the Peach Perfect. A definite favorite bar of mines now and will be going back this weekend. All of the bartenders are great with beautiful attitudes and customer services. Scale 1-10..... 9.7
author: B'Nic G.

description: Came here before a Yelp event to have a few drinks during happy hour got to say I left this place pretty happy after 4 cocktails. Our bartender was awesome. I had 2 cucumber gimlets and a shot, drinks where really good and strong. On the day we went it was wing Wednesday. I know they have a taco Tuesday $2.00 tacos, hope to make it up to the city on a tues to check it out. Try and get a table cause the spring chairs at the bar aren't  or uncomfortable.  Will be back for they're good drinks.
author: Dennis T.

description: A fantastic bar with a beautiful theme. Circus style decorations accent the beautiful woodwork and design of this modern classical bar. Filled with great people, live atmosphere, and friendly bartenders, this bar rates as one of the best places to go for happy hour in SF. They have a fantastic selection of cocktails and mixed drinks for $8, and great craft beers for $6. Be sure to try their very own Topsy IPA, you won't regret it
author: Vlad S.

description: Great vibes from the second you walk in. Pouran was a lovely bartender and gave us awesome service. Delicious Moscow mules and food! Will definitely come back here next time I am in town!
author: Caleb R.

description: HH. National taco day. Beer and shot $12. Chicken and carnitas tacos. Full house. Great staff. Sitting next to a fun lady talking about the tacos and yelp.
author: Linda N.

description:
Went here for happy hour with some coworkers for Thirsty Thursday. Their cocktail menu is interesting and surprisingly delicious! Every one at our table enjoyed the cocktails they got. Peach Perfect was to DIE and I highly recommend. 

Had no problem getting to the bar and didn't have to wait. Topsy's itself had a lot of people in it but wasn't overly crowded. Definitely had to yell in order for people to hear me across the table though. Bathrooms were clean and easily accessible. Plenty of screens with an assortment of sports on. Funky décor throughout. Will be back again!
author: Summer B.

description:
Delicious food and drink - we had the chicken quesadillas and homemade hummus and oh-my-goodness! Literally scraped the hummus bowl clean :)

Drinks were great - cucumber gimlet was refreshing and satisfying
author: Alexandra C.

description: Really nice bar with classy environment but don't feel out of place if you're super casual
author: Travis K.

description: First time at this bar and it is great!! The bartenders are very friendly and attentive and the cocktails are good! I came here for happy hour and I had such a good time with friends!!
author: Lois K.

description: Went here after going to Rickhouse. Went there on a Saturday not crowded at all so we were able to get a drink quick. Some seats outside and plenty inside. Spacious. Will come back
author: KB B.

description: Such a fun spot and conveniently located right near Montgomery Bart Station! Great spot for happy hour after work. Good music, good vibes, fun people, and super nice bartender! I recommend the cucumber gimlet, it's so refreshing! Definitely come here with coworkers and friends!
author: Tori O.

description: Fantastic place! Great drinks, loved the cucumber gimlet. Deviled egg trio was a great value on happy hour!
author: Kimberlee K.

description:
Tacos were actually pretty good, but if cheap tacos are your thing you probably shouldn't be out of carnitas by 8 PM, especially when that is one of only two options. 

Drinks were bland. Deviled eggs (free with checkin) also had basically no taste.
author: Jason F.

description:
1). All day happy hours on Monday is always nice.
2). Chicken quesadilla was pretty good.
3). It's a small simple bar
4). Not too many frills or anything terribly exciting, but good drinks and good bites. 
5). It's relaxing and pleasant but didn't blow my socks away.
6). Good quality for what you pay.
author: Robert W.

description: Great place for after work drinks! Happy hour on Fridays! Delicious drinks and food + friendly staff
author: Abigail C.

description:
Springy seats, side booths, happy hours between 2-7 that includes cocktails, wines and beers and live music at 8:30pm, what's not happening about this bar!

They also serve up small bites and provide awesome, charming service (from the bartender in charge at that time).  I ordered up their Strawberry Basil Martini and it reminded me of a smoothie, but spiked!  Delish!  Add the Ruby Sipper cocktail and it will surely get you going!

You can topsy, turvy me anytime!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Once upon a time I woke up in the mood to make bad decisions. I stumbled into this bar filled with interesting decor. 

I immediately hated it. It was grungy, and the circus theme made me feel like I was stuck in a horrible 'trip' at the Circus Circus. Then I realized I had become an SF snob. 

So a week later I went to Rickhouse for my 2 cocktail special. It came out to $40 and I lost it. As I made my way east I heard a roar of people chanting and singing. Topsy's was calling my name. I decided 'give it another chance'. 

I'm glad I did because this place has easily become one of my top 10 bars. The service is amazing, and the servers are FAAAANNTTAASSTIC. They give a nice pour and I always walk out with more regrets than I walked in with. 

Give it a shot, and don't mind all the random clowns.
author: Danny M.

description: My second time here and I love how chill this place is. I love the bartenders. They're friendly, not overbearing, cute ;)
author: Soundarya C.

description:
I wanted a good bar. Something a little different than I might have at home.  Something a little crazy and over the Top.   The name makes it sound like it would have fit the bill perfectly.  It didn't.  It was a bar alot like at home.  No "fun house" vibe on the Saturday night that I went in around 11:00.  But in retrospect, that is pretty much what I needed that night.  A moment to chill with some newfound friends.

And chill we did.  I drank two Negronis.  Both were what I would consider high quality.  They had the right balance and the right flavors.  I was able to sip and not guzzle.  The bartender was friendly and had a great accent.  And one of the best features of this bar...it was less than a block from my hotel!  And the the BEST thing that happened that evening was that my new ACRONYM friend (and non-drinker) Jai sprung for the whole tab!!  Talk about cool friends!!

I'm guessing the bar started out as some high concept bar...but it didn't really catch on, concept wise.  But they serve affordable cocktails and still have a pretty nice place.  I will be heading back here for sure when the wife and I get some date time in the city even if it is just to get a nightcap and head back up to the room.
author: Robert S.

description: Meh, the drinks were just average. Fairly dark and dingy inside...more of a dive/sports bar. Much rather go to Rickhouse or Pagan Idol right next door.
author: Daniel F.

description: Awesome bar! Super friendly bartender and great all day happy hour on Mondays. Good ambiance, great decor, good prices for the area. Definitely plan to come back.
author: Alex C.

description: Nice cozy place. Music is loud enough to be enjoyable, but quite enough to let you talk without damaging your vocal cords
author: Leo V.

description: Came for the all day happy hour on Monday... stayed for the service! Had an awful day. Lost my luggage on the day i arrived in SF. Went to find a happy hour to drink about it and came about this place. I can't turn down a themed bar. Its my thing. Although this generally looks like any kind of bar, the amazing service sets it a part. Ali, was personable, made great cocktails, wasnt pushy, and even went out of his way to accommodate my crazy request as a traveling visitor. I love this place and will deff come back anytime im in SF.
author: Katerina R.

description: Super cute bar. Popping after work happy hour spot. Taco Tuesday was pretty good. The drinks and bartenders are pretty awesome.
author: Denise L.

description: Don't miss out on the happy hour here! They play great 70s and 80s hits and the service is awesome.
author: Tiane K.

description: Great music and super friendly bartender. The old fashion was perfectly made.  Two thumbs up!
author: lura m.

description: This is a delicious bruschetta. Good bar + food! Great service and ambiance. Nice staff.
author: Joanie M.

description: Randomly stumbled on this place and had to stop in! Great atmosphere for happy hour after work! :)
author: Shaylin B.

description: This is a great spot for happy hour! Drinks, food, and service all on point! Try the Charcuterie plate!
author: Richard J.

description: Updating my review...It's great to go to a HH spot in FiDi where it doesn't feel uppidy, but it can get loud. Despite the crowds, I always manage to find a seat and the staff is friendly and attentive and friendly. I love the circus theme. They offer normal bar food, but it's good.
author: Laurisha C.

description: I came here 2 years ago for my birthday and had so much fun, I had to come back again. It was even more fun the 2nd time around. For a place that's unpretentious and you can have out of this world drinks AND service, this is the place.
author: Nicole P.

description: I love the dive bar minus bitter old men bartender minus dirty bathroom. Young cute friendly bartenders greets you immediately when you get in. Music that they were playing from pandora was...something I normally hear at Japanese or Korean cheap diner in Japantown. If you could tolerate, this place can be good! Bartender says live Jazz on Wednesday night. I need to check it out!
author: Miyako U.

description: This bar is great! I've been a few times, mostly after work, love their happy hour. Their mixed drinks are always great, and the staff is friendly
author: Anne L.

description:
Great place for Happy Hour! Good old fashioneds, and the house white is decent for the price. 
We also ordered the bruschetta, the hummus, and the charcuterie. The bruschetta is good, but a little sweet. The hummus and the charcuterie plate are pretty good though!
Would also recommend the lychee martini and the Paloma.
Great service, definitely plan on coming back.
author: Ji-Ho P.

description: This was a super fun, laid back atmosphere that we were looking for tonight. I loved the old school music choice!!!
author: Kaylynn K.

description: The bar had a great atmosphere. Service was ok. Not my favorite place. Highlight was the bar stools!
author: Kathy E.

description: Really cute and inviting bar! Has a little bit of something for everyone. Great decor and crafty and beautiful cocktails! Stop by if you're in the area!
author: Kristy V.

description: Check in and get a free appetizer - sounds like a deal to me:) thanks to Anya and Adela for the great service and the info about the deal!!
author: George B.

description:
Wow does this place get busy during happy hour!  But I still love this place.  $8 for a good cocktail during happy hour, love it.  The menu here has a pretty big variety of drinks.  I really liked their lychee martini which wasn't too sweet.  Their strawberry margaritas are also great and dangerous.  

The inside of this place is pretty small, like what you'd expect from an SF bar.  So keep in mind that seating can be limited.  They have quite a bit of tables though and people are friendly enough to squeeze in everyone.  They also serve some food here, but didn't try any of that yet.  

Also got to mention that I really enjoyed the bartenders here.  They're really on top of their game, and can tell when you need something.  Excellent service!
author: Bryson L.

description:
This is a nice bar in downtown sf that makes some great tasting cocktails. The Topsy Mule with whiskey was a solid drink. Cocktails were priced at $12, but they do have happy hours until 7pm during which you could get them for $8. 

They have a pretty sweet 100" screen, so it's a nice place to watch a game. Also, don't forget to check in on Yelp and grab your free appetizer.
author: Zoher Z.

description: Great spot! Good happy hour pricing ($8 cocktails before 7 pm, amazeballs for FiDi). The staff is friendly and the gilded ceiling reminds me of more old school SF bars (e.g. homestead/shotwells). If you need a place to start the night off with some quality drinks, look no further.
author: Shine N.

description: Awesome little bar that has a great happy hour with good service! On Monday's it's happy hour all day  def recommend trying out the bar!
author: Rima D.

description: The ambiance and the staff is great! It's a wonderful place to hang out, chill and have laugh!
author: Irina N.

description: This place is amazing! It has a great atmosphere and the people who work here are so nice. The drinks are all yummy - I recommend the pulled pork sliders.
author: Kara S.

description: Good Happy Hour! Not a bad deal, and a great Yelp Check In Offer (if you remember to use it-- whoops)
author: Sabra M.

description: This bar is amazing! The bartender, Ali, is one of a kind. Our drinks were delicious and the service was stellar. Best bar in the area by far! We went on a Thursday night and got to participate in "Ticket Thursday". You could win a great prize!
author: Jackie E.

description: This is my favorite bar in the Financial District! The food and service are top notch. The Strawberry Basil Martini is my go to drink.
author: Michael R.

description: This place has a great atmosphere! The homemade IPA is not hella hoppy- more smooth and balanced. The music is spot on as we are from the Easy Bay. We came for a quick girls' night and decided to try the happy hour and we're pleasantly surprised.
author: Sheek D.

description:
I went to Topsy's because of my friend's recommendation. I have been told that it is a fun place with the great cocktail menu and excellent service. 
My friends were absolutely right! 
I enjoyed amazing cocktails with freshly smoothed fruits! The atmosphere was wonderful. There is whole Monday happy hour! On Tuesdays they have margarita menu! So I am going back there today!!! 
I wish DFW area had such great place...
author: Susana S.

description: First time here today! Came for happy hour. Drinks are amazing! Our waitress was adorable, very nice and helpful! Will be coming back soon!
author: Britt N.

description: Really good drink, good price, fun crowd, and great service! Lots of young people and in the middle of the financial district. Came here after work by myself and greeted by nice people. So fun!
author: rosie b.

description: We love the peach perfect drinks so much we got 3!!! The Topsy mule is very good as well and during happy hour it's $2 off ! Tuesday - Friday 2pm -7pm
author: Jenna L.

description: The hubby and I decided to do a little cocktail exploring  while in San Fran.  Topsy's was one of the places we opted to go prior to dinner.  In need of a little food, we got the hummus.  It was good, nothing spectacular, but it put food in the belly prior to drinking which is always a good thing.  I opted for the "Monkey Business", a mixture of rum (flor de cana 7 yr), sweet vermouth, and chocolate Bitters.  Though I don't normally go to rum as my first drink, I will say this one hit the spot.  Sweet (but not sugar sweet), creamy (don't you just love chocolate bitters?) and very well balanced.
author: Carol W.

description: This is the perfect "hole in the wall" bar. The decor is fun, the music is not too loud so you can actually have a conversation with friends, and the staff is very friendly. So glad to have this close to my work for happy hour! Which, by the way, they have all day on Mondays :)
author: Agustina G.

description: I work in the financial district and decided to come after work for happy hour. Planned to stay for one drink with a coworker and ended up staying for FIVE. Our bartender, Ali was PHENOMENAL. His knowledge and recommendations were on point and I couldn't of asked for better, more honest recommendations for drinks as well as service. Will be recommending to my coworkers, friends, and future travelers. Please go see Ali.
author: Ashley S.

description: Solid spot to frequent on a quick little weekday with the birds. Sick taco Tuesday and respectable wing Wednesday plus lively Fidi crowd and good spot to watch games make it a no brainer post up spot.
author: Kamil S.

description:
The bar stools are on heavy springs, so difficult for a short gal to get stable - no footrests.

The bar was PACKED on a Tuesday night after work. Drinks are in the $9 range, and while they were well-crafted, they were weak and the service was slow (b/c they only had two gals making drinks.)

(On Tuesday's) The $2 tacos were cheap, but pretty tasteless, don't bother unless you need a "booze sponge".
author: Amy W.

description: Sat at the bar for a good 15 minutes and watched the bartender serve every single person that came in after me, including the people right next to me who came in 10 minutes after me, even though she clearly saw me.  She was the epitome of wasted motion.  Walking back and forth for no reason and working only half the bar as if too lazy to tend the whole bar.  Refused to order a drink as she finally came by, called her out and walked out.
author: Oliver V.

description: Made it for the Monday All Day Happy Hour with a good buddy of mine. Drinks were fresh and delicious and the service was excellent. A special shoutout to the kind bartender, Ana!
author: Jo V.

description: Awesome service! Great happy hour! Fantastic drinks! Definitely will come back. Had the Topsy Mule, Strawberry Margarita and the Cucumber Gimlet.
author: Caitlin O.

description: Great bar for our first night in San Francisco! The waitress is very welcoming and the atmosphere super nice :)
author: Dimitri D.

description: The food was delicious, the service was wonderful, the drinks were perfectly crafted! The 4 stars instead of 5 is because our table was soooooo small it was hard to make room for plates and drinks. We ordered appetizers and had to balance our plates on our laps to make room for the appy plates and our drinks on the table; there still wasn't room enough for the appy plates and we almost knocked two of the plates and our drink on the floor. Not a good idea to put a party of 3 at a table that truly isn't big enough for one person.
author: Nicole C.

description:
What a strange, but awesome place. The bartenders are attractive and friendly, and you never feel ignored.
THE BARSTOOLS ARE GIANT SPRINGS. Sit on them. Bounce. Smile.
Don't forget to look up behind the false ceiling.. lots of creepiness up there!
author: Tim R.

description:
Awesome Spot!!!
Really cool place! Great service! Amazing drinks and badass cocktails!!! Plus for who appreciate high quality beers they have Franziskaner on tap, so enjoy!
Anna the bartender took a really good care of our group!
Definitely will be back
author: Ernest S.

description:
Love this place! always good drinks and welcome bartenders :) 
on Happy hour you just can't pass by!
author: Ana R.

description:
Business travelers beware. I warned the server ahead of time that we would need to split the bill and I discreetly let her know that I was the only one in the group on an expense account. At the end of the evening they did indeed split the bill for us, but they would not present me with a receipt that was not itemized and that showed only my amount. To make things much, much worse, the manager came over and made an attempt to explain why they are the only vendor in town who cannot offer a simple receipt that's not itemized and only shows the individual's amount and in doing so the rest of the group became aware that I am on an expense account. This is something I've kept from my coworkers for obvious reasons. If you're on an expense account and you expect to be treated the way you are at every other restaurant in town that has no problem presenting you with a simple non-itemized receipt and not making a big deal out of who has what, this is not your place. We will not be back. Every time I'm in town we choose a place to go have happy hour or a meal or both. This will never again be one of them. Unacceptable! There are too many great places in the city that think nothing of giving a receipt, something business travelers never think twice about. Go elsewhere.

I'm editing this review because as you can see the manager responded to me and the review via Yelp. As explained to him in person there were four of us paying but they would only accept three credit cards. Since I was the only one with cash I paid with cash. The fact that they could not offer a receipt I could use was explained at the time, yes, but only AFTER they ran the cards and took my cash. And how about the fact that they came and blundered around and made it known to my coworkers that I am on an expense account. Manager: You know exactly what happened, since you were there and you were the one who did the blundering.
