It just didn't occur to you at the time that I would use Yelp to air how badly you handled the situation. I'm letting others know, beware. In this age of yelp, and most people checking before they try a new, or even an old place, you can't get away with this anymore.
author: Carol L.

description: Amazing delicious drinks, super friendly waitress and of course the kick ass charcuterie board. What more can anyone ask for? Pouran, girl, you kick ass!
author: Khuyen N.

description:
Decent watering hole. Circus/toy store like theme. Went during happy hour so the scene was full of professional millennials looking to wind down. Atmosphere was kind of loud but still personal enough to hold a conversation. It gets pretty packed in there to where you have to compete to get a drink at the bar.

I'm more of a beer drinker than I am a mixed drink drinker. But I tried two of the menu crafted beverages. Can't remember the names, but one was very reminiscent of a Moscow Mule and the other had cucumber garnish and flavor. Refreshing, but nothing outstanding though.

I realize I'm from the deep south where a dollar stretches a lot further, but I went here during happy hour where they claimed to have a happy hour special. It was $8. A happy hour special to me is 2 for $8 or 2 for $10. Or 1 for 1 specials. Or maybe even a shot of Jaeger or something. Jeez!

But overall, the place was pretty good!
author: David F.

description: $2 for a decent Taco Tuesdays is not bad and the circus funhouse theme is unique. But I will call them out on dirty dishes. Bartender handed me a new glass cup with a lipstick stain and side appetizer plates that had grease stains before our food came out . Although it was busy, it's NO excuse to reuse dishes they saw could pass off as "clean" at first glance.
author: Briget P.

description: Topys is my go to bar in fidi after a day at work the happy hour drinks are great and the snacks are even better. They even have a wing Wednesday deal!
author: Mariam B.

description: Solid spot for cocktails and small bites.  I sampled one of their gin-based signature drinks and pulled pork quesadillas.  Both were satisfying to my pallette.  I spent a Tuesday happy hour killing some time, and while nicely packed, it was not overly crowded.   Surprisingly, not as whimsical as the name suggests and is more posh and lounge-y than I expected.  The kicker: being a 90's hip-hop afficionado, I was absolutely thrilled when Method Man's "Bring the Pain" was followed by more East-Coast beats over the soundsystem.  I thought most bars/lounges killed the genre to cater to newer tastes, but at least at this spot,the music lives on.  Hope the vibe is the same on other days, can't wait to bring the crew.  The parking situation sucks, naturally, but there is a parking garage next door.
author: R Y.

description: Bartender made us a specialty whiskey drink. Delicious and would highly recommend asking them to "surprise" you with a cocktail.
author: John G.

description: The food is the best, the beer and drinks are great and the environment is superior! Must check this place out!
author: Donnell J.

description: I think more "Topsy's Drunk House" would be more appropriate. Plenty of regulars filling up the place way to early for a mid week work day. I was from out of town so the timing of my visit is excused as per the "Visitor's Code of Drinking and General Fun Whilst Traveling" handbook.
author: Fred B.

description: Tasty mule, great happy hour and a great atmosphere! Location is close to downtown. Happy hour has $8 mules.
author: Rosemary A.

description: Topsy's is absolutely one of the coolest places i've been in San Francisco! Ali made me an amazing custom drink that blew my mind and the atmosphere in the bar is warm, cozy, and very friendly. I will absolutely be back :)
author: Haley C.

description: Great place for happy hour after a long day of work! Got the strawberry martini and it was delicious. Saw tater tots and the menu, I'll definitely have to try next time!
author: mina d.

description: The quesadilla was fantastic. The Fun house has a great vibe and the waitress Pouran was super nice! Everyone else seemed to enjoy their drinks and the music was super good. There was also a good amount of seating for a bar in SF, can't wait to come again!
author: Navid A.

description:
Took some clients here after an event for casual drinks on a Monday. Great drinks, good casual atmosphere and a good number of people there especially for a Monday.

I brought a bag and forgot it at the bar. I woke up that morning, realized that I forgot it, and freaked out. I had an early flight and needed it. 

I emailed and called the number listed at like 7am and actually heard back quickly from the GM. He went out of his way to enlist a bartender, Vika, to come and help me well before the bar opened at 2pm. She was so nice to help me out when she didn't have to so I obviously tried to tip her to thank her but she wouldn't accept it. 

I'm from out of town and understand how the bar has the good word of mouth it has. I stay at the W San Fran frequently and will definitely be back next time.

Thanks so much again.
author: Anthony R.

description: What a great little spot! Always have a good time at Topsy's. The prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is comfortable.
author: Christopher L.

description: This place is ' Steady Rockin All Night Long'  to 80's Freestyle music--Ordered a cocktail, Topsy's Mule, it was  G-O-O-D; the kitchen was not open at 3:00 so you lose a star for depriving me of my charcuterie. However, the service and drinks were excellent, "I Can't Wait" to come back again for cocktails!
author: Aaron M.

description: Stopped for cocktails and now enjoying a yummy appetizer. Thanks Pouran and Anastasia!
author: Sandee T.

description:
This place is by far one of the best bars in the Financial District! Great place for happy hour drinks and food! Well crafted cocktails and good selection of craft beers!

Also, the staff here are all amazing and friendly! With that said, I highly recommend going there on Saturday nights. The atmosphere is very cosy and ideal to converse. Did I mention that the two bartenders on this night are by far my favorites?? Go there and you'll see. :)
author: Amine C.

description: Stopped in here on a Thursday for some after lunch drinks. Despite the time, service, drink quality, and food was excellent. Will definitely be bringing more people here in the future.
author: Chad S.

description:
The place had great aesthetics inside.

It is a tightplace and I understand given that it is downtown. 

What I do not like is fixed barstools that are hard to place and plant your feet. The Moscow Mule was delicious but it was hard to enjoy with the awkward stool.

I am giving four stars for slightly overpriced drinks and uncomfortable barstools.
author: Sean G.

description: Great place for happy hour cocktails! (All day Monday and 2pm-7pm Tues-Fri). Wish they had food specials too though!
author: Jillian C.

description:
Entering the bar, it was such a stark contrast of mood lighting to the sunny day outside.  I want to say that the lit and bright pictures on yelp were a little deceiving to how dark the place actually was. Maybe the picture takers were there at an earlier hour.  Well anyway, it was 5:45pm on the dot, and I was ready for some happy hour fun. (All the cocktails are $8).

I decided to get the George Dickel Old Fashioned.  It was a bit disappointing, unfortunately.  I had read a yelp review earlier in the day saying that their whiskey selection wasn't the best (with the exception of Yamazaki).  The drink was bland, sour and watered down.  That sounds terrible, but it was decently ok.  The second drink I had was the Red Top.  That one was several times better.  I liked the sweetness with the added wine float.  I barely tasted the flavor of the ginger whiskey though.  With my second drink I ordered the Veggie Sandwich so to not go the night on an empty stomach.  The arugula salad that accompanied the sandwich was literally just arugula and it was colossal, taking up 2/3s of the plate. It had a nice vinaigrette-y flavoring that was probably tossed with the leaves.  The sandwich was pretty good. The bread was lightly toasted with a creamy curry aioli sauce.  My only complaint is that the veggies were not just roasted, but cold and soggy.  It had a good flavor, but it could have bumped the sandwich to a whole other level if it was only just a bit warmer and firmer. 

The last drink I had of the night was the double daddy IPA.  At that time I was sufficiently buzzed (Sorry, not sorry that I'm small and Asian).  It was pretty standard for a double IPA and I enjoyed it.  

The waitress we had was very attentive and friendly. I give a solid thumbs up on the service.

However, a big complaint that I have is that it is so unbelievably loud. The entire night I had to raise my voice significantly just to I can hear myself talk.  To top that off, they added a live band at the front of the bar at around 8:30pm.  I love live bands, don't get me wrong, but at this point I was yelling and my friends still could barely hear me.  This bar is definitely not big enough to support the acoustics of live music at an enjoyable volume.  

Even with my critiques, this place is really unique and cool! I love the circus/creepy circus props and decorations.  On the ceiling, there is a hanging display of old furniture, toys and things (Not to worry, there is also a metal slate/net to keep it from falling on anyone if you were worried. It looks pretty stable though). 

I may or may not refer this place to a friend, which is unfortunate because the decorations are so awesome.  The drinks and food were good, but the noise level can keep people from a good time.  I still had fun catching up with friends, but it was definitely an issue.

Ambiance: 3/5
Food & Drinks: 3.5/5
Service: 4.5/5
Overall Experience: 3.75/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description: What a bar. Went there late Monday night and there was live funk/jazz/blues music. Russian bartender Viktoria  is amazing and she makes killer cocktails. Fender bar stools look silly but are actually very comfortable. What a pleasant surprise seeing Franziskaner on tap. Enjoyed my visit very much and would recommend Topsy's to anyone.
author: Srdjan T.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE

The vibe, the bartenders, the ambiance, the decor, the service, the patrons, the drinks: Love it all!

Great place to hit up if you are in the city, they have superb drinks... so good you won't be able to get enough (we were almost late for a show lol).  It has a very AHS Carnival theme going on and the patrons are pretty interesting... although I did go on a friday during the happy hour time so it was mostly hot men in suits with a few engineers in jeans... such a great view!

Overall, I would definitely come here again, and again... two thumbs up!
author: Sara N.

description: Terrible service! I was just there about an hour ago with 2 other people and we waited forever just to order our drinks. We wanted to order food but no one came by to take our order. I got so frustrated by the long wait that I eventually went to the bar and asked the bartender if we were supposed to order up there. She said no and that someone would come take our order "momentarily." The fact that I went up there to ask about ordering should've been an indication to her or the staff to bring send someone over. As you can imagine that never happened. As another 20 minutes went by, our drinks finished, and no waiter/waitress to take our order, I eventually, again, went up to the bar and ask for our check. Needless to say they didn't get a tip and I won't be going back. Do yourself and others a favor and avoid this place
author: Philip C.

description:
I like this place a lot.   They make their own beer and it was pretty good.  On Mondays it's all day Happy Hour.   Which I think they take a dollar off the beer from $5 to $4.  It wasn't too expensive at the end of the night.

They had live music at 8pm.  

If your looking to just drink beer and it also has 2 screens to watch sports.   Not overly divey or pretentious really good mix.
author: Homer S.

description: Beautiful bar, good location for us, and normal San Francisco prices(which are a little high).  Nice bartender that was very personable and attentive.  We sat at the bar and also in a booth after our group all showed up.  I had a basic fireball whiskey on the rocks($9).  Beautiful presentation for such a basic drink with super clean glass and a very good looking block of ice.  Great place for a couple drinks.
author: Ryan H.

description: Such good drinks such good food! Everything has been wonderful, and it's an amazing building.
author: Natasha O.

description:
This review is solely on their happy hour cause, well, I've only been here for happy hour. (Not an alchy, I promise!)

Happy Hour:
- Monday: All Day
- Tuesday - Friday: 3pm-7pm
- $8 well drinks and $5 house beer

Cute decor, super comfy seats at the bar, intimate seating at the tables, nice selection of cocktails, and delicious house beer. Bartenders and the crowd are also awesome. Will definitely be back!
author: Christine S.

description:
Ali at the bar is awesome! Fun, professional, a true artist with the curation of classic and exotic cocktails.
We randomly walked into the bar and stayed ....and stayed. Awesome blues band played all night and we drank all night. What an amazing Wednesday...yes, Wednesday!
author: Uni V.

description:
Topsy is a great new find in the FiDi area. Very trendy vibe with decent seating. The bartenders are above average and well staffed.

I ordered happy hour Old Fashioneds all night which were well crafted. They were decently strong but not overpowering. 

2 TV's with sports and dimly lit. 

Not a great whiskey / scotch selection but they DO have Yamazaki. 

Best of all it's next to Ramen Underground for post-drink munchies.
author: Chris W.

description:
Solid drinks, great location, groovy live band at 8pm, and HAPPY HOUR ALL DAY MONDAY!!!!!

place has lots of neat stuff to look at, a decent cocktail list, nice bartenders, everything! 

Food was OK, not great. Pizza was pretty damn tasty though. 

Seating is very cool, but I could see myself rocking a little too much on one of them springy bar stools after a couple drinks. 

Great place to drink in the FiDi !
author: Adrian M.

description: Fun little place with cool barstools but, wow, the shortest pours I have ever seen. Order from their drink menu because anything straight or on the rocks is poured from a thimble at the same price!
author: Brendan M.

description: Bartender Ali is an awesome guy that makes awesome drinks. The reason why this place gets 4 stars instead of 5 is because when he left, the vibe left for my wife and I, which resulted in us leaving and hitting another bar. If you come here, ask for Ali and ask him for his handcrafted off the menu cocktail. Simply delicious!
author: Andy N.

description: Great friendly staff. Good music. Great beer selection because they have hefeweizen and nice food menu with fun cocktails!
author: Natalia G.

description: Good times w live music and delicious drinks. Both bartenders working last night were nice and drinks did not take long to make at all.
author: Sam Y.

description: The place was quite empty even for a Tuesday night. Had a couple of drinks and shot right to the next place on our bar hopping spree!
author: Akanksha B.

description:
For a fun house I was actually expecting more of an overt carnival theme, but this bar veered on the "normal" side of ambiance: slightly dim, music playing, spacious enough. 

Went here for wing Wednesday--you get to choose from three different wing "flavors". To drink, I ordered a Moscow Mule. It was pretty standard, $8 was decent for cocktails at happy hour.

Service was friendly!
author: Naveena S.

description:
This place is fantastic.
I go here whenever I can.
The staff is always pleasant, the cocktails are good and the food is good.
I always walk away with an outstanding feeling
author: Steve E.

description: I come here regularly after work. It's a pretty cozy spot. The staff is friendly, the cocktails are tasty, and they pour a tall beer.  And they've got like 3 TVs for whatever sporting event is going on - go Warriors! The kitchen is open most of the time.  You can't go wrong with any of the pizzas. And that's all I have to say about that.
author: Nadir A.

description: Great service, good happy hour specials, tasty drinks.  A great place to meet friends after work.
author: K V.

description:
Great cucumber gimlet. 
Craft beers.
Live band!

Had a milestone day and celebrated here after work. 

Jazz band on a weekday! Plus!!
Happy hour till 7pm.
Plenty of seating. 
Service was pleasant. Not intrusive.
Loud but not too loud. 

Fun place! Will be back for HH.
author: Sonya T.

description: Great place with lots of room, great music, & good music! Happy hour is also good, especially for after work.
author: Dalia V.

description: People are great, the atmosphere is awesome, and the drink are perfect.  Plus, Russians!  Definitely come and have drinks!
author: Jeff C.

description: This place is really easy to find and has a great happy hour. The place to go if you are visiting the city like us or a local working in the financial district!
author: Priya T.

description: I love topsy's. It's so close from work and their happy hours are the best ! I recommend the 1921 Honey.
author: Leslie G.

description:
Love the decor and ambience of the place. Don't forget to look at the ceiling and the spring chairs while you're there. They also have a big screen to watch games. 

They have a Yelp checkin offer to get free hummus. It seems like they ran out of hummus while we were there but the servers were nice enough to switch it up for a plate of bruschetta.
author: Manasvi S.

description: Solid bar, great cocktail list, friendly bartenders, nice looks, and happy hour prices all day Mondays. What is there not to like???
author: Massimo M.

description: After mixing up my calendar and ubering downtown for a blood donation appointment that was supposed to be the day before I set out to find a happy hour spot instead. This place had great vibes and delicious HH drinks! I got the 1921 Honey and it was exactly what I needed for a Friday after a long week! Great place, chill atmosphere and quick/friendly service.
author: Jenny L.

description: Wonderful place full of energy and joy.  Great drinks and great bartenders.  Topsy's mule is one of the best drinks ever.  Best bar in financial district.
author: Dan P.

description: Classic and fashionable place to come and hang out after work.  Relaxing atmosphere, delicious drinks, and excellent bartenders.
author: Adam S.

description: Fun atmosphere, good screens for sport games. Taco Tuesday: $3 tacos. Friendly service. Festive for Halloween.
author: D G.

description: Gonna eat free bruschetta because their happy hour rules! Free bruschetta : happy hour
author: Makenzie L.

description:
Go here before you head somewhere for dinner. Or, go here after work. Or, for some of you, go here before work.

I was there on a  Saturday at like 7pm, we got some seats, our table ordered everything from Sauv Blanc to Moscow Mules to the Topsy....and we all liked what we had. Great bartender- she could handle the orders pretty fast and had a great personality. You'll like the funkiness here.
author: Donald C.

description: My girlfriends and I came here last week and we had a really good time. We loved their cocktails and food (BBQ sliders were my favorite). The bartenders Olya and Larissa were super nice and friendly. We will definitely come back again!
author: Anya T.

description:
was really pleasantly surprised at this place! how popular it is, how delicious the drinks are, and how good the happy hour prices are! BIG FAN. and bartenders are nice and efficient! and you can watch sports while you enjoy! 

the only downside is that it gets crowded and loud..
author: Christina L.

description: Nice Ambience was kind of crowded for Happy Hour. I had the pulled pork sliders and a few Moscow Mules. Bartenders were fast and also attractive.
author: Koby G.

description:
This is a fun bar in SF if you are looking for speciality cocktails which seems to be the trend. Great happy hour till 7 with cocktails for 8.00 and craft beer for 5.00.  

The 4 stars is for the quality of drinks served here. Great atmosphere for sipping drinks not recommended for a first date unless your looking to scream to talk or exchange a few words. This place is packed and only 2 bartenders and 1 waitress but you wouldn't know it as our drinks continued to come. Definitely recommend.
author: Melodie C.

description: Topsy's has a great atmosphere with cute, interesting decorations. Service is friendly and drinks are tasty. Great for a date or after work drinks. And happy hour all day Monday! Would definitely come here again.
author: Brittany R.

description:
I found my new Monday night waterhole. Happy hour all Monday and it's the perfect place to go after work with a couple of friends. 

Music is nice and the drinks are delicious! With happy hour pricing, even better! I love looking at the upside down toys hanging on the ceiling too. Bartenders were friendly and had excellent memory on who ordered which drinks throughout the night. Lots of seating available. Next time I might get some snacks too.
author: Winnie T.

description: Great place to grab really good cocktails. Had a few good ones-- cucumber giblet & Strawberry twist (my fav!) Prices are good, not too over priced and cool things up in the ceiling!
author: Erica L.

description:
Pros: Good cocktails. Gets crowded during happy hour but I can still find a seat if I wait around a bit.
Cons: Get too loud, hard to hear my friends talk. Obnoxious drunks at the bar wouldn't stop bothering me and my friend. 

I would still go back for the cocktails.  Well crafted and tasty!
author: Jaching H.

description: Amazing Strawberry margaritas!!! And the giant screens to watch the game on are a huge bonus.
author: Crystal C.

description:
A common theme behind discovering what my favorite bars and drinks are is that I just happen to stumble upon them by accident. The No1DP and friend/fellow Yelper Aren A. stumbled across this bar as the bar we originally planned to go wouldn't open until later. We also had time to kill until dinner.

VENUE: A circus-themed bar smack dab in the middle of Financial District. Their stools consist of giant springs or car crankshafts mounted on brake drums and are fun to sit on. Several drinks later they are still fun to sit on.

SERVICE: We had the pleasure of being served by one of the best bartenders I've ever encountered. ALL of the drinks made by this bartender were excellent. Perhaps this was because we came right when the bar opened on Saturday afternoon and the bartender had the time to prepare our drinks. No1DP noticed that the bartender paid special attention to my drinks while quickly preparing drinks for the guys across the table.

DRINKS
- Strawberry Basil Martini, $10 (Russian Standard, Fresh Strawberry, Basil, Lemon). Russian Standard is one of my favorite vodkas because it is very smooth when consumed neat or in a mixed drink. The pureed strawberry was blended just right so that it blends nicely into the drink. 
- Dry Passion, $11 (209 Gin, Passion Fruit Nectar, Orgeat, Ginger Liqueur, Lime). I am not a fan of a gin and I especially hate the taste of bad gin; a sign of a *good* drink is if the other ingredients blend in with the gin well enough to complement or hide the taste of gin. I tasted more of the ginger and passion fruit than the gin. 
- Twisted Berry, $8 (Svedka Vodka, Fresh Lemon, Ginger, Passion Fruit, Fresh Blueberries). A variation of the Strawberry Basil Martini but a bit more tart due to the ginger and blueberries. Like the Strawberry Basil Martini the final consistency is a smooth fruity drink. This is one of their newer drinks.
- George Whitney Margarita, $9 (Espolon Tequila, Agave Nectar, Fire Water bitters, Lime, Cucumber). Though this was Aren's drink I loved this drink as this was another example of a hot jalapeño margarita done right. This meant that a good tequila was used as the base as I've tasted horrible jalapeño margaritas using subpar tequilas.
- Contortionist, $11 (Ketel One, Honey Syrup, Cardamon Bitters, Lime). No1DP's first drink. The cardamom was the highlight ingredient but only enhanced the drink. 

No1DP had 2 other drinks that were more sipping drinks that consisted of strong but good-quality whiskey.

Supposedly has all-day happy hours on Monday. I'd love to come back here and explore more of their drink menu. I would consider this one of my top 10 bars for craft cocktails.
author: Isabella B.

description: Topsy is actually fun. It's really dark and there is a lot of EDM, which is kind of unoriginal In SF. It also doesn't fit very well. But the drinks are good and the music and atmosphere creates this really up beat attitude that seems to project on everyone. If you're in the area, stop by and try one of their house drinks.
author: Matt F.

description: One of my favorite bars to visit in the Financial District. Plenty of seating, TV's, and creative drinks. Not to mention the amazing bartenders. Definitely recommend coming here after work!
author: Ashley C.

description: Great fun atmosphere and amazing cocktails! Especially love the lychee martini and the strawberry basil martini!
author: Marianna L.

description: amazing vibe. quick drinks. dank food. Pouran is so on top of it and I'm def making this my reg happy hour spot
author: Benjamin R.

description:
Cute place!  Still got packed enough on a Monday night.  Found out on Mondays their happy hour was all night long.  We took awhile to decide what to get because my group of friends hadn't seen each other in awhile, so we chit chatted first.  Guess that was a big mistake since there was only one bartender working.  So we had to go up to the bar to place our order after awhile and still waited awhile for drinks.  She actually made a non-happy hour drink for me mistakenly (so it was $10 and not $8) but because it took so long to get drinks in the first place I kept it.  

After she (blonde woman) brought us our drinks she asked for a credit card right away.  WTF..rude much?  Don't you want people to enjoy the ambiance, spend more and keep a tab open?  Finally as we were about to leave we saw a second bartender starting (before 7pm).  

Cute decor & spacious bar.  Good drinks (I think I ended up with the Strawberry Basil Martini instead), but bad service!  Hopefully it was just an off night.
author: Cat C.

description:
Rarely in Downtown SF, I stopped by for Topsy's Monday happy hour. Read the last sentence carefully: stopped by.... Three hours later, multiple yummy drinks later, I felt like maybe Monday night is where I need to be, establish a tradition or something.
A mule, a greyhound and some other magical creatures kept begging me to stay, so I did and even got appetizers. I loaded up on deviled eggs which were perfectly done with just enough pickled something to make me want more. 
To sum up - great unpretentious atmosphere, top notch drinks and deviled eggs with the recipe worth stealing. Monday evening was not wasted.
author: Viola B.

description: I luckily stumbled by here on Monday (Happy hour all day- wooo!) $8 cocktails, $6 (i think) craft beer & wine by the glass. I had a great moscow mule for $8 so I was happy. I didn't try the food, but the inside has very dim lighting and is set up with high-top small tables and low couches so I wouldn't have a full meal but it would be fine to have some social bites/appetizers. Dark and loud inside but I really enjoyed the fun vibe!
author: Victoria E.

description: Love Topsey's! Great food drinks and service what else do you want? Oh yeah it's cheaper at happy hour.
author: Bill B.

description: First time here and we enjoyed ourselves. Laid back environment with great happy hour drinks and the manager Rueben was social and attentive. I would comeback the next time I visit Cali!
author: Camille B.

description: Topsys is a great happy hour place. Bartenders are social and more than willing to make a drink that perfect for you
author: Sara D.

description: Awesome bar! Very good service and friendly staff. A fun place to stop by after work and unwind. The drinks are on point and the food is delicious. I had the prosciutto and arugula pizza and their old fashioned and 1921 honey cocktail. 10/10 would recommend.
author: Mia M.

description: Fantastic place! Love the drinks, great environment and specially the bartender Ali, he's the man. Highly recommend this place
author: Moe S.

description:
I came to Topsy's for the first time last weekend during SantaCon. This was my group's last stop and I think by the time we arrived most of the Santa's had spread out through the city a little more. We found an open spot in the lounge/booth area right away with enough space to sit 8+ people.

The service is friendly and speedy - we all got our drinks quickly even with a crowded bar. I only stayed a short while but enjoyed my time at Topsy's and would love to come back again for a meal or to watch a sports game.
author: Olivia M.

description:
Was pleasantly surprised by this bar! Came here when it was almost brand new, this bar is very clean so pretty. The bar is not too small and not too big. 

Couldn't decide on what I wanted, so I told the bartender I was in the mood for something fruity. She made me a cocktail with fresh grapefruit juice and some other fresh juices and tequila. I don't remember what it was called or exactly what was in it, but it was SOOOO good!! I could taste the freshness of the house juices that the friendly bartender made me cocktail with, and she only charged me $9 I think. I saw some cocktails that other people were drinking as well, and the presentations of their drinks are SO pretty!!!! I was very happy with my cocktail. This will definitely be a go to bar for me whenever I'm in the neighborhood :)
author: Amanda R.

description: Topsy's is great! I work in the financial district and honestly I'm not a huge fan of most of the bars there. Topsy's is a reprieve. Cool people, nice vibe, good happy hour.
author: Becca O.

description:
This is one of the best bars in the city and definitely the best happy hour spot in financial district. It has literally everything for everyone - beer and flat-screen TVs for sport fans, great selection of unique craft cocktails, wine and delicious food for girls' outings, comfortable sitting arrangement  for business meetings and after work gatherings. The decor is warm and cosy and the stuff is super nice and friendly. Topsy's will soon add their own beer to the public ( can't wait to try it). 
If you there try Strawberry Margarita and my favorite drink Back Flip.
author: Yuliya K.

description:
Oh lovely Topsy's, how convenient and perfectly situated next to my office you are.  Probably one of my favorite places to start a Friday off at!! Topsy's has the quirky atmosphere and quality happy hour to make any day a Friday.  

Drinks 10/10:  To really get your bang for your buck at your Topsy's experience make usre to get there for happy hour.  $8 cocktails and $5 craft beer is the way to go.  This doesn't sound all that special price wise but I love the cocktails here.  I've tried most all of the them and the hands down winner is the Cucumber Gimlet followed closely by the Lychee Martini. These aren't overly developed, crazy ingredient cocktails but dammit they are executed perfectly every time. They also have a good variety of beer both in bottles and on tap INCLUDING the ever illusive KCCO Black Lager that i like so very very much.  

Food 9/10:  Now I have not had a chance to try a huge variety of the food, mostly going for the easy shared plates.  The bruschetta is awesome and so is the pizza.  The ONE thing that I still  must try is the Taco Tuesday experience.  $2 tacos and a roulette of margaritas is something that I can get behind after a slow Tuesday of work.

Give Topsy's a try.  The atmosphere is awesome, the staff are fun to talk to, and the crowd is very low key.  If you're looking to rent out a space too they always seem to have reserved tables for larger groups.
author: Ryan F.

description: The ladies pour a STROOOOONG cocktail! The space is roomy and dark and there is always good conversation to be had, only a barstool away!
author: Nick S.

description: I like coming to this place whenever I am searching for a bar in the Union Square area.  It's a nice vibe and really good cocktails.  So far I've only tried the Lychee Martini and Peach Perfect and both of them are really good!!! $10 for a cocktail, $8 during happy hour (all day on Mondays!).  I freaking love this place.  Service is excellent as they make sure you never have an empty glass in front of you! Definitely one of my favorite bars in SF!
author: Cynthia L.

description: Amazing place. Amazing drinks. I visit this place very often, great ambience. Good for hanging out with coworkers.
author: A M.

description: Topsy's has a great All Day Happy Hour on Mondays. A go-to for after a busy work day. The staff is very friendly! It's my first time here and am definitely planning on coming back again soon :)
author: Lauren S.

description: If you visit San Francisco, please come to Topsy's Fun House. You can find the best drinks, best atmosphere and best music. Also, the bartenders are very fried my and knowledgeable about drinks. Love this place. I wish I have it at Miami
author: Susej M.

description: Great bar to kick back and let go. There is a DJ on Thursday with awesome music and the Topsy mules are a must try! Also, Larissa is great:). Can't miss this local hot spot in San Fran!
author: Slammin S.

description: Great place and free app with a review!  Drinks are good - fresh juice mixers and a generous pour. What more could you want. Happy hour 2-7
author: A B.

description: Cute ambiance in a perfect location. Great place to pop in for happy hour drinks on your way to the rest of the city.
author: Hoai N.

description: Came here by myself but it's such a fun vibe. The chairs are springy, and it's an awesome atmosphere to wind down. Also, it's Taco Tuesday, which makes it more of a fiesta.
author: Lindsey M.

description: Chill little neighborhood bar in the Financial District. Dark and cozy but not divy. Never seen a cleaner bar in my life. Having bartended in my previous life I know how hard it is to stay on top of the spills. Super friendly bartender/owner. She pours a good shot.  Great sound system. She says when it's not Christmas there's jazz playing. Unpretentious, and comfortable. Definitely at the top of my SF bar list.
author: Toan D.

description:
Atmosphere is great at Topsys. I always grab a drink here with my buddies whenever I'm in the city. The bar has a really classy vibe and I'm in love with the spring barstools lol. 

The bartender here is the best! Can't remember her name, but she's quick and talented with the drinks! I've definitely made this bar my goto spot whenever I'm in SF.
author: Jonathan I.

description:
Another of my favorite FiDi bars. Drinks are well-made and offered at standard FiDi prices. Their happy hour menu is solid and the bar itself has a cool feel and lots of couch seating along the wall. The bartenders are attentive and friendly and the central location of Topsy's makes it stand out.

Also the massive "spring chairs" lining the bar are pretty cool.
author: Irina P.

description:
I'm reviewing Topsy's Fun House as both a bar and event venue. Angela (one of the owners) so kindly allowed us to use the front section of Topsy's as a last minute private event venue. ALL of the staff members were always so kind to our guests and attentive to our needs, whether it was the timing of food or volume of music. Shout out to my favorite bartender, Inna!

My favorite cocktail here is the strawberry basil martini (or margarita) which is a popular choice here! All of their cocktails are delicious, and they have a creative variety. Happy Hour is ALL DAY on Mondays and Tuesdays through Fridays from 3PM to 7PM. 

My friend raves about their pulled pork sliders, and their other popular appetizer options are deviled eggs and tomato bruschetta. Check this place out if you are in the area. I know I will coming back several more times and bringing all my friends with me! Thank you Topsy's for a wonderful event experience.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Great place to hang out after work to grab drinks with coworkers. Not too crowded / loud and has TVs for sports games.
author: Mayur C.

description:
I was intrigued by the theme of this bar. Honestly I was expecting something quirky, carnival-esque, but when my friends and I went there on a Thursday evening, we were totally disappointed. First of all, the clownish decorations are minimal; in fact you can barely tell that there's a theme at all when you step inside. I feel like with a fun house theme, either go big or go home. 

It was only 5:30 but they were blasting techno so loudly that we could barely hear each other over the bar table. The crowd is pretty financial bro-ish, which I guess is to be expected given the location, and it seemed like every table other than ours was taking shots and being obnoxious. The drinks on the menu are pretty average for a cocktail bar and their happy hour deals were far from enticing. We tried a few different cocktails and then quickly left...the pounding techno music was giving me a headache.
author: Regina L.

description: Great bar, cocktails, and happy hour. All of the cocktails were $8 for happy hour. I recommend the Mule and Cucumber Gimlet. Fun little spot!
author: Taylor H.

description: Strong and tasty drinks, happy hour prices when applicable, music, good location, and very importantly, patrons that don't take themselves too seriously. Pouran was exceptionally great! Attentive and fast. So many reasons to go back!
author: Alex R.

description: After a day of walking around San Fran we found this gem. Great vibe and music. Cocktails and service were on point! Try the Back Flip if you are a gin lover!
author: Emelyn B.

description:
On a recent trip to San Francisco, I picked this bar basically by putting "bar" into Google Maps and picking somewhere nearby--I decided on Topsy's because the theme sounded super kitschy, but the place is quite nice.  The circus colours and themes are all a bit muted, so that combined with the dim lighting it's quite a nice ambiance inside.  The tables were a mix of high top (closer to the window) and lower height tables, with booth seating on one side and ottoman-type seats on the other.

They had a nice range of beers on tap, with five or six different options.  At one point I ordered the Lagunitas IPA, which it turned out they were out of--the bartender was fantastic, though, and immediately brought me a couple tasters of the other IPAs on tap so that I could choose a different one.  I was sitting at the bar so I got to watch all the cocktails being made, and it made me wish I'd gone for those instead of beer; everything looked delicious and very carefully made. 

Price-wise, this place was fairly standard.  Beers were between $6 and $8 depending on the brew, and cocktails seemed to be in the $9-$12 range.  I was there on a Saturday, so there weren't any specials, but the weekday happy hour on the menu looked great too.
author: Heather M.

description: Friendly staff, great music and an eclectic mix of travelers makes this a great spot to hang out and meet new people.
author: Ximena C.

description: Pretty good spot for happy hour or just to catch up with some friends and have a good time. Drinks are decently priced for the area and the decor is pretty cool. They have spring bar stools that sorta bounces, goes along with the theme/ name of the bar. I've only came here once, but I'd love to come again!
author: Bailey L.

description:
Oooo, I love stumbling across a new gem! Last night we were heading towards Rickhouse when we were drawn into the new place next door, beckoned by the man-sized nutcrackers at the door. This is an intimate bar with a smashing/whimsical design. I especially love the art nouveau chandeliers over the bar! There is also an amazing installation in the ceiling- it looks like a sneak peak into the attic of a retired circus ringleader (the person who designed it must have spent weeks combing flea markets and estate sales). The L-shaped bar is cool, white marble. I'm a sucker for a vintage-style joint with elegant touches. But I digress. 

Now for the important points- the cocktails are delicious and well-crafted. My group favored the spicy margarita (fresh lime juice and just a touch of jalapeno) and the Dickleberry cocktail (bourbon and fresh muddled blackberries!). The cocktails were served in coupe glasses- a nice touch. The cocktails were $10-12 each- pretty typical for San Francisco. Decent selection of beers on tap. Several friends work in the neighborhood so I'll be suggesting this place as a new happy hour option.

The bartenders- gorgeous in black dresses with red bow ties- were all friendly and surprisingly efficient. One of the gents in our group commented that they brought to mind Mad Men era bunny club cocktail waitresses. As a gal who favors vintage clothes and high heels, and longs for the days when men regularly wore well-tailored suits in the evening, I love places where the staff looks stylish (I don't count hipsters in this category). I heard a mix of accents behind the bar, too (Brazilian? Russian?).

The crowd was an interesting mix. Some charming fellow with a huge leonine mane of blond curly hair was standing behind us at the bar, ordering a round for his group, and he told the bartender to throw in another round for my group just because he was having a good time negotiating some deal (or so he said) and felt like sharing the love. Awww, that seals it- I'll be dragging my friends back here for sure.

Our bartender said the theme is based upon a historical night club out near the Cliff House (which I googled, of course- it was called Topsy's Roost). Wow! I wish we still had a night club with chicken coop booths with slides to the dance floor and a swinging big band!
author: Mishka L.

description: Ali is phenomenal! This place has an amazing happy hour too. Diverse as hell. Great time!
author: Diana A.

description:
Came here with some friends for a happy hour.  I love the interior, bartenders know what they are doing and great happy hour specials.  I went to order a drink at the bar and a large group had just placed their order so the bartender was a little swamped.  He surprised me by comping my drink, which wasn't necessary but very thoughtful.

Can't wait to come back.
author: Nick G.

description:
We made a reservation for 20 people for a company outing here and loved it!

The drinks and food were great, the staff was friendly and easy to get ahold of, and we all had a blast.

Plus, they didn't charge us to reserve the space, just for the food and drink. Very fun and easy spot for a happy hour in the FiDi.
author: Sophie B.

description:
This place is an surefire gem in the FiDi!! 

I have a blast ever time I'm here! Whether you are a regular or a first-timer, the staff here always takes good care of you!! 

I want to send a special shoutout to the superb bartender and my good friend Ali! 

Tell him what you like and he will concoct a cocktail like you've never had before!! What separates him from others is that when you order your drink, he exceeds expectations!!
 
Trust me, this place is awesome and Ali and staff turn this bar into an Experience!!
author: Omid S.

description: This is my first yelp review and I seriously felt obliged to give this bar a stellar review. I came here after work for a quick drink and ended up staying for 5 drinks, solely because of their amazing cocktails and bartenders. Ali made specialty drinks for a friend and I, and they were honestly some of the best I've ever had in the financial district. I would recommend this bar to any one of my coworkers of someone that just loves a place to chill and socialize.
author: Caitlyn C.

description:
I really wanted to like Topsy's: good reviews so far, and I like to support new businesses, but alas, it was not such a lovely experience.The bar has a cute atmopshere inside, but the lifesize Nutcrackers standing outside are creepy and make me feel like it's Christmastime or I'm in some weird Toy Land. The place is narrow and long, but small, one bathroom and it's super hot in the back, ventilation issues? 

My friend and I found a spot at the tail end of the bar, were given a menu by a nice bartender (who looked burnt-out already at 6PM). I ordered the 1929 Honey (?? can't remember the name!) and my friend got the drink with bourbon and rosemary.

Um, did you use alcohol in these drinks? I felt bad for the frazzled bartender as she was likely feeling pressured while her micro-managing supervisor was hovering nearby. But the drinks were still sub-par, and my friend's was half empty, and it was $21, not including tip, not cool, it was happy hour! So we finished our drinks and headed to trusty old Rickhouse. Maybe Topsy's just needs some time to grow and settle in.
author: Crystal C.

description: Great Thursday happy hour, followed by a DJ and raffle. Probably the most fun I've had downtown after work. Highly recommend. Also, try the Strawberry Margarita.
author: Frankie S.

description: This is a place that is also supposed to serve food.  Therefore, it should be kid friend.  We stopped there today to get a drink and food, however they told us we were not allowed there with our 10 year old, because the manager wouldn't allow it because he needed the seats for drinking customers!!!  Horrible service and management.   Also smelled very bad inside  so we just left.  Don't waste your time here... much better places nearby.
author: Tammy F.

description: Great bar, fair prices, good vibe, and friendly staff, even the bartender did his job superbly, free of attitude or nonsense during a very busy period.  I'll admit I was a little apprehensive, based on the name, of inviting a more staid friend of mine here.  But we both thoroughly enjoyed the place.  Fully recommended.
author: Steve F.

description:
The only thing that's good about this place is that it's a few steps away from Rickhouse, where you can enjoy a real cocktail. 

I came in on a Thursday evening and it screamed post-work happy hour. I got an old fashioned I think. Or maybe it was day old bar water, orange juice, and an artisan ice cube.

Don't let the other reviews fool you -- this place isn't a magical circus wonderland, and the spring bar stools aren't special, and you don't need to skip your Pilates mat class to have the energy to sit on them.

Walk past it on the way to Rickhouse.
author: William M.

description: Great bar in the financial district to watch the game or grab drinks with friends.  My fiance and I met up with another couple for drinks here on a Friday.  Bartenders were friendly and knowledgeable.  I had the Topsy's draft beer, which was very similar to an IPA and it was delicious.  Highly recommend this place if you're in the area and are looking for a fun sports bar.
author: Matthew V.

description:
I enjoyed the place, very nice service, I got my favourir beer and waitress was very nice and professional
Spent only three hours.
author: Andy L.

description:
Fun place to go to. Great area and pleasant visitors.Live music. Good place to meet some interesting people.
5 star service. Highly recommended
author: Art H.

description: Great place for a nice craft cocktail or a pint of beer! Perfect location in the financial district, excellent service, but I personally come here for bartenders!;)
author: Aleksandr G.

description: Beautiful bartenders and a fun atmosphere make this a great place to enjoy a beverage after work.
author: John B.

description: Really fun divey bar with themed drinks. It's not as crowded as the other bars in the area.
author: Connie C.

description: Don't know much about bars, but glad I yelped and found this place. Lychee Martini is the drink to get! Took awhile for someone to come to take my order, considering it wasn't packed, but they made up for it once they came to take my order.
author: Keana C.

description: Cool place, spring bar stools and deviled eggs... okay check out the Old Flame if you want a new twist on a old fashioned.
author: Jon C.

description: Love this place! Such great drinks and food. The bartender, Larissa, was so sweet! Will definitely return.
author: Sarah W.

description:
It might be impossible to not have fun here. When you're next door neighbor is Rickhouse, you've got serious competition. BUT, Topsy's is a refreshingly unique spot amidst a plethora of craft cocktail / wine bars. Love the casual, let-down-your hair feel this place has got going.

Bar staff is super friendly and attentive and cocktails are on point. Both a blessing and a curse that I pass Topsy's on my daily walk home. Needless say, I'll be back again and again.
author: Brianna M.

description: Nice place. Atmosphere is darkish with classic vibe. Food is good drinks were good. Reasonably priced and good service.
author: B R.

description: Great drinks. Happy hour all day on Mondays. Also, good short list of appetizers. I made a dinner out of the bruschetta on arugula and quesadillas, Helpful since Rickhouse next door has no food. Excellent jazz band came on around 9.
author: Bill T.

description: Great spot, good food. Good vibe. Got wing Wed. Service is great. Get the gimlet, it's delicious.
author: Amanda F.

description: Fun decor and hoppin on a Thursday night! Great happy hour deals with tasty drinks. What more can I say....oh wait, super cool bartenders too!
author: Pia Maria B.

description: Everything was completely fine from the bartenders to the drinks, but could it be anymore boring when advertised as a circus clown bar? Do something exciting... something.
author: William L.

description: Good post-work happy hour spot, with quality cocktails. They have a couple of TVs so it's definitely possible to watch a game here.  Note that while there is seating here, it can get very crowded (it's not a very big space), but it's still a good option if Rickhouse (just a few doors down) happens to be packed.
author: Andrew E.

description: Good vibes! Good drinks! Good service! Angela was not only cute, she also made delicious drinks and was fun to talk to. Definitely going to come back here for happy hour!
author: Dennis X.

description: Nice place however we came right when the opened so I can't give a fair review. The service was great and atmosphere looked fun.
author: Karen R.

description: This place is a fun laid back place. The bartenders were fast and made great tasting drinks. It was a Tuesday night so service should be fast of course. Lol prices are standard $8-10 for a drink so get ready to spend some money. But draft beers are large and reasonably priced and next time I will try the food.
author: Player L.

description: Had a great time, but the free hummus appetizer was not all that great.  The fun bar chairs are why they are called tipsy turvy and that was fun after s few drinks. Great for an after work drink!
author: Alex P.

description: Had the blast here! They have the best craft cocktails. Their happy hour drinks is a great deal, they have taco Tuesdays , awesome music and just great atmosphere.
author: Alexey O.

description:
Not much going on during the weekends in the Financial District.  Found ourselves wandering around and finally whipped out a cell phone and asked Yelp what was in the area.  What?  A carnival themed bar?  Yes sir!  We jammed over in a hurry.  I expected a lot more circus theme, it's really just a regular bar with some circus paintings, although they do have some funky camshaft and spring barstools that I would steal if they weren't 150 pounds...
Anyway, the prices are about average for SF, meaning my Austin friends were shocked.  Hey, if you order a lycee martini in San Francisco, yes it is gonna be pricey...
Anyway, pretty much just ok.  The parking was easy on a Saturday at 5, and not many people in the place.  Bathrooms clean.  The big win was for the service.  The bartender, Larissa was super hot and super friendly.  She actually came out from behind the bar to our table to take our drink order.  She made a great drink also.  I can tell the place may be a zoo on weeknights, but fine for a casual drink during off hours...
author: Ken P.

description: This place is seriously awesome!  It is a unique and one of a kind place that really is special.  It also is one of the few places I can think of that is equally appropriate for a date night or a guy's night out.  The live music, when it is playing, makes it just even more awesome!
author: Phillip B.

description: Awesome pizza and very personable mystery bartender dude!  Ask for the spicy bitters to out on your pizza.  Yea, you heard me!
author: C P.

description:
Great place with delicious cocktails and super friendly baristas. Music was right on, not too loud to have a conversation and perfect to create a fun atmosphere.
Strawberry Basil Martini is a must try! We are definitely coming back for more :)
author: Y A Y.

description: The drinks are delicious and there's a really fun atmosphere. Management and bar tenders are also super nice!
author: Emily P.

description: This is an average, normal bar with prices about $3 above average. The specialty cocktails are good. The bartender I had didn't have a huge personal repertoire outside the menu. The spirits selection is unimpressive. The beer selection is poor. At least the music was inoffensive and not to loud while I was in. There's one TV but it's not really a sports bar.
author: Eric S.

description: We hosted a happy hour for our clients at Topsy's and could not have been more pleased with the outcome. The staff was very reliable and worked with us non-stop from the weeks ahead of our event to the very end of the happy hour, making sure that every detail was executed to meet our vision. The space is already unique in design, but the General Manager and Owner worked together to decorate the space even more, to fit the theme of our party, and handcrafted custom cocktails to match. They worked well with our external vendors and helped to coordinate their on-site activation. This is going to be a venue that we rely on for events in the San Francisco area and highly recommend them to anyone looking for a great space to host a private party. We can't wait to work with them again!
author: M M.

description:
Cool place but very slow service, some of the worst I've seen. Definitely in need of a 3rd bartender.

The bartender made eye contact with me several times but served the couple next to us twice without serving us. I was just waiting quietly money in hand.
author: Veronica L.

description: Great atmosphere and delicious drinks!! Love the place. Should try their food - very very good stuff. Will definitely be back
author: Vadim K.

description: Awesome Bartender!! Delishious Apps! and the Drinks were Yummers!! I will be back fo sho!!
author: Denine J.

description: Topsy's Fun House features a circus-themed bar with giant springs as seats. Pretty cool bar, but decorations can be a little bit creepy as you look above your head. I definitely think this bar gets packed after work hours. Even if it's packed, you can still be able to have a conversation while drinking your drinks. Plus, the bartenders are very friendly. I had their Strawberry Basil Martini that night and I really liked it! Smooth and delicious. Prices are decent and reasonable. If only I worked in the Financial District, I'd definitely be back for their happy hour. Otherwise, I'll for sure be back to try their other drinks! :)
author: Philana C.

description: Amazing drinks! Ambiance was excellent! Romantic yet still able to have a conversation. Moscowe mule was served in a COPPER cup!!
author: Jesse T.

description: Come here for a stiff drink and a good time. Came here after work on Wednesday 10/7. Great customer service from the bartenders wish I caught their names. Will definitely come back and next time I'll bring my coworkers!
author: Blake M.

description:
I usually don't write any reviews but I must say that my husband and I didn't like this place at all. They charged us $25 for two glasses of white wines even though we went there during happy hour and asked for "happy hour wine"
Also it was too loud inside to hear anything! We will never go back there again.
author: Kaya M.

description: Regardless day or night -Topsy's is absolutely my favourite spot in San Francisco.  Had a very delightful evening here with friends last week. we come here for best cocktails and atmosphere. Stuff is very knowledgeable, friendly and always surprising  me with new special cocktails that are not in a menu . This Time I tried a super yammy "green drink" and i fell in love with it. If you enjoy mixed drinks , then it's a MUST GO PlACE . A big thank you Topsy,s for the best service . love It !!!
author: Olga O.

description: Went here for taco tuesday last week. The tacos were delicious, as were the moscow mules and strawberry margaritas :)
author: Nicola C.

description: Cool, hip and loud as hell! This would be a perfect place to meet your girlfriend if she is pissed and gonna let you have it, or if you have been elected to "Jerry MacGuire" a colleague after work hours. No one will be able to hear a thing you say! Service was slow but slammed. The drinks were to perfection. If drinking is your deal, probably a must go.
author: Jim M.

description:
Dark little spot with brass and copper fixtures and a generally sultry look.  Enter from Kearny st.

There is a drink in a copper cup that is like a Moscow mule.
author: M S.

description: My ideal bar. Good drinks, fun atmosphere and music. The appetizer wasn't great, but the drink selection was impressive.
author: Hannah H.

description: It's nice enough. It was very rowdy for a Happy Hour during the week. The food is bar food, which is great, but I'm not sure its actually cooked or warmed up. Probably won't be revisiting any time soon.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Their strawberry margaritas are delicious! Service was amazing and I love the atmosphere.
author: Kelsey W.

description:
I really only came in here because I needed to use the restroom. And I am glad that I did. As to not look rude (and feel guilty about using them for the loo), my friends and I decided to order a drink before heading out. 

We ordered what was the newest addition to their menu, the Dickel Berry specialty drink. It was fantastic! It was sweet but you could still taste the whiskey. It was the right amount of alcohol for me as I started to feel it a little later.
author: Kim N.

description: Great old fashioned.. Great bar.. Good music with a good feel to the bar. Tremendous bartender from Moldova.. Definitely come for a drink! Or three..
author: Matt B.

description: Great Bar!  I really like the atmosphere, the drinks and the bartenders.  Quality drinks and so much fun for happy hour.  Well worth it!  I highly recommended.
author: Oscar B.

description:
Perhaps one of the most exciting emails you could ever receive from your boss starts with: "I have a task for you.... Can you find a place for us to have happy hour?"

Naturally, I turned to Yelp to find our venue. It had to have a few critical things:
- Opens by 3pm 
- Has a happy hour (duh)
- Has enough space for the 20+ people joining us that afternoon
- Has a TV to watch the World Series

Topsy's fit the bill, so I contacted them to see if they were able to accommodate our group in such a short amount of time (3 days notice). SUCCESS!!!!! Angela was very responsive and gave us a few options around seating/space and food. She was easily accessible and was very helpful in setting things up.

Our group came in waves - which was no issue for Topsys. They were prompt with getting drink orders, asking about food orders, and checking in on us to make sure we were all doing well. Our group eventually dwindled down and other patrons came to invade our space, but not a single drink was added to our bill that didn't belong there! I would say that's a win.

Drinks - GREAT. I heard zero complaints. The cucumber gimlet was fantastic, and the strawberry basil martini was a crowd favorite.

Highly recommend for group events! We will be back for more!
author: Mar A.

description:
We came in here on a lark to have a drink before continuing our wandering into Chinatown. I miss having fancy cocktails so I was excited to go through the menu and find something unique and interesting to try. I chose the Strawberry Basil Martini while my partner picked out something else that I totally can't remember now. 

Service took a bit longer than I would have expected given the number of people in the bar (ie, not empty but not crowded either) but eventually we had our drinks and we settled into the padded bench to sip and take in the decorating.

This place is definitely odd and strange in the decorations. Toys are held up on the opposite side of a wire mesh ceiling. The seats are worn and old looking, making the place look more antique than it really is. The sign outside, a colourful carnival styled font, along with the two large wooden nutcracker statues next to the doors give the impression that this is a place for kids but it couldn't be further from the truth. The lighting is really dim but it adds to the strange atmosphere.

This was a neat place to hang out for a round of drinks and relax for a bit. There was a tv showing some sort of sport thing, but it was muted which was great since it was pretty loud to begin with. I couldn't imagine yelling over the noise of a tv event going on. 

Would happily come by for drinks again.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Fun little bar in the Financial Distrct. It's a funhouse themed bar with not too crazy bright decorations you would probably imagine when reading the name of this place. The seats at the bar are like giant springs so you can bounce around and it's pretty darn cool! Definitely added to the experience as my friend and I bounced on our seats while conversating and sipping on our drinks.

I had the Strawberry Basil Margarita ($10) and it was DELISH!! I also had the Topsy's which I heard was really popular, and I am not sure if the bartender made my drink too strong but it kind of felt like I was drinking straight up Don Julio tequila. Other than that, fun themed bar with delicious cocktail drinks. Try it out!
author: Cris-ann L.

description: Service is good - but top shelf is lacking especially in a town like SF - music system overly loud and not to where you can hear a lick of what is playing more like the subway platform quality sound. Bar tenders are quick and cheerful. Fix the top shelf and get a star upgrade the sound so people do not have to yell and perhaps you get another star !
author: Phillip T.

description: A really cool and hip after work hours bar that I am happy to have stumbled upon in the city.  Dimly lit with really cool ceilings (check out the clear glass section above the main walkway by the bar), Topsy's Fun House is inviting and unique.  Many specialty drinks on the menu which were both refreshing and tasty.  Friendly atmosphere with close quarters (we were more than happy to share chairs with the party next to us and they were greatly appreciative), this is a gem in the Financial District for good drink.
author: Reena P.

description: Awesome venue with great music.  We really enjoyed off-menu drinks recommended by the bar tenders.  Definitely a go-to spot in FiDi.  We ordered the pulled pork pizza and chicken quesadilla and we were thoroughly impressed.
author: Michael H.

description: Horrible bar poor draft selection and the bartenders are not friendly! One of the bartenders overcharged me and was rude
author: Omar i.

description: Reuben was very friendly and was very knowledgeable about the HH and drinks I would most def come back for Wed for the tatortot nachos
author: Jahaziel A.

description:
Topsy's was the third stop on our self guided cocktail tour of San Francisco. It had some stiff competition, and I must admit, I was a little hesitant to order a cocktail here. It sort of looks like a dive bar. But yelp never fails me, and once again I was delighted.  The strawberry basil martini was beyond divine. It easily could have been a sugary sweet drink, but the table kept it so well balanced.  And compared to the other bars, so much more affordable.

The true treat at Topsy's was the bartender. Not only was she tremendously skilled, she was also so amazingly personable and adorable.
author: Kate D. B.

description: Really fun spot. Geat happy hour. Solid food menu. Always have fun.
author: Andrew E.

description:
Love this place! 
Drinks are well made and cheap! 

Awesome music and gorgeous bartenders!  

One of my favorite places to hang out after work at the heart of FI-Di. 
After the new owner took over this place has became alive and cool! 

One of my all time favorite drinks are:

Old Flame
Basil Haden's Kentucky Bourbon 
Angostura Bitters
Flame of Absinth

Girls will love Strawberry Basil Martini and at $10 it's very nice!
author: Xela H.

description: Omg I love this place!!! Awesome atmosphere and nothing but good vibes. Definite SF gem! The staff is amazing and Ali, in particular, turns this place into a party! Even on a Monday. ;)
author: Alexandra S.

description: Great drinks, friendly & quick staff, not too crowded, & price under what you'd expect. New favorite bar near downtown.
author: Brandon M.

description: i came here for my friend's bday happy hour the other day.  the happy hour here is a good deal, as many of the cocktails are $8.  the beer and wine pours are also huge.  only complaint was that it was super loud, even though we were sitting at a table near the door.  i'm probably just way too old.
author: Helen T.

description: This place is very fun for after work happy hours, with impressive service despite the crowds. The mule is awesome and only $8 during happy hour! Or for something sweeter, the peach perfect and cucumber gimlet make you feel like you're one the beach :) Highly recommend!
author: Saila B.

description: My husband and I came here on our first night visiting SF. It is a really cool bar, with decorations unlike any we've seen before. (Hello clowns!) The drinks are quite good (he ordered a Moscow mule and I had something called Peach Perfect), and the bartender was very nice. There was live music, too, but they were packing up right as we arrived (it was around 10:30 on a Monday night). Overall a cool place to go!
author: Cory P.

description: Really great service, bar tenders have fantastic personality and full of local info. Checked in and received a free app also! Awesome happy hour cocktails.
author: Stephen W.

description: One of the best bars in the city. Great drinks and athmosphere. Happy hour from 2 to 7 during the week. Live music Monday and Wednesday. DJ on Thursday. Will definitely be back.
author: Slava K.

description: Topsy's is one of the best places to stop by in Financial District(FIDI) for happy hour.  The service, ambiance, and drinks are phenomenal.  Their old fashioned are well done and solid presentation.  I take all my friends to topsy's when they visit.
author: Orlando L.

description:
I was a regular at Playland on Pine and Franklin for over a year. Then Angela (one of the owners) told me she was opening a new bar. I was skeptical at first bc the staff at Playland was so amazing that I couldn't believe she could recreate that. Well... She did. 

Topsys is so amazing. Great high end cocktails with an upbeat atmosphere. Rickhouse, which is next door, is known for their cocktails, but they take at least 20 mins to make. Topsys' has cocktails equally as delicious and high end: however, they are made in less than half the time.
author: Andrew C.

description:
It had just started raining, my feet were killing me, and we were getting pretty grumpy. Then, like an onimous, creepy old-fashioned toy store from a horror movie, the entrance to Tospy's came into view. We really did think it was a toy store at first and walked right by, sidestepping the spooky life-size nutcrackers outside.

Anyway, something shiny caught my eye and we went back, and Topsy's turned out be an insanely adorable circus-themed bar. Like 1920's big top, side show circus. Cool photos, creeptastic little clown statues, a hammered tin ceiling, and super fun bar stools on giant springs.

Our bartender was great, although it probably helped that we were there during happy hour and it was very quiet. We had a manhito (mojito with whiskey), Topsy's (tequila, pomegranate juice, whipped egg white), whiskey and water, and a really tasty cider on tap from Oregon. Everything was delicious, beautifully prepared, and good strength. A little expensive, but I'm used to Sonoma County prices - still, I'll definitely go back to try some more of their adorable drinks!
author: Rachel M.

description:
Very cool after work spot. I like the spring based bar stools and the specialty cocktails. The Dickleberry is my personal favorite.

I also enjoyed the ceiling decorations in the front and back of the venue with turn of the century chotchkies.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Had about a 4 hour wait before I needed to show up for a appointment at the indian visa centre. So my dad and I stopped by here for World Cup coverage. 

I gotta say. I'm not a beer person, but this place had Goose Island Sofie, which is the only one I can drink without regretting the decision. $8 a glass is pretty expensive, but considering the area, it's alright. 

The server was really nice, she was watching the game as well. We also ordered the shrimp sandwich, which was around $20 after tax and everything. It was creamy and came with a side salad. It was pretty bland as far as sandwiches go, but the salad had a nice vinaigrette. 

They didn't have brisket or pulled pork when we went in. Bummer. 

The spring barstools were a nice touch, too.
author: Armie T.

description: Fun place for happy hour in the financial district. Good crowd, great bartenders, fresh drinks and nice appetizers.
author: Krish S.

description:
Serendipity. I really believe in it.

During the day, I had read about this place on Eater SF, but it was just one of many articles on the blogs I followed. After work, I was out celebrating (long story) and bar hopping. My friends and I went to Rickhouse, but even with my friend flashing cash around, it was difficult to get a drink. So we said, hey, we noticed another bar a couple of doors down---let's just go there!

It turned out to be Topsy's. I didn't make the connection at first (though I thought it was weird I had never noticed this place before) until I noticed all the clown pictures and remembered reading about circus themes. Aha! This is the place I had read about! How fortuitous I ended up here! It was meant to be!

The drinks are super tasty.  I tried three of the cocktails (the berry one, the margarita, and the martini) and loved each one. My favorite was the strawberry basil martini. Plus the crowd is fun. Some guy was asking randos to sign his friend's birthday card. And we swear that there was a time traveler with a handlebar moustache sitting at the bar, just observing...

There are some growing pains here. Like the other reviews mention, we were waiting a long time for our drinks. Then we asked for the check, and they charged us for the wrong drinks and for more than what we ordered. But--and I don't know if this was in connection with or independent of the bill situation--the owner was sitting next to us and offered to buy us a round of drinks. It made me feel appreciated, like they cared about its patrons (though, to be fair, this definitely colored my rating).
author: J J.

description: Definitely a fan of this place. It's close to the office, the staff is friendly, eats are good, and you can watch games. And if you've never looked up into the ceiling - better head back for another round. :)
author: Chris T.

description: Welcome Topsy's! Jennifer the bartender is such a delight! Our neighborhood needed this spot. Casual. Great crowd. Solid music choices!
author: Jessica V.

description: Came here a few weeks back with a small group of friends and I was really happy with the drinks I ordered. Drinks here are *strong*, so the long island is no joke. Service here is also great, and not once in the night did I feel like I had to fight for a spot at the bar to get my order in. Definitely coming back.
author: Austin W.

description: Fun place for happy hour and delicious pizzas!!! Irish mules were the bomb for our group, very refreshing and tasty!!! One server on the floor, but she was very attentive to our table and everyone else! Looking forward to come back!))))
author: Eugenia S.

description: I celebrated my birthday here a couple weeks ago and every one had lots of fun. The drinks are very reasonably priced especially for a location in the Financial District. For a Friday night, it was not too crowded which I did not mind at all, had nice background music, and what I love the most is that no one was telling us we can't go in and out, or that we cant stay outside for as long as you want to. Usually at other bars or clubs in the city they control how many people go outside  and what not but not here. Also no cover! One thing that this place needs is a second bathroom. I felt like through out  the whole night there was a line for the bathroom.
author: G O.

description: The best happy hour spot in the financial district. Great drinks, awesome bartenders.
author: A R.

description: Times are always fun at Topsy's! Their commitment to making exceptionally delicious well-mixed cocktails and providing entertaining environment makes me want to come back every time!
author: Lena K.

description: Fun environment and great happy hour  the bartenders were so friendly ! Definitely coming back after work more often.
author: Mariah S.

description: Very nice atmosphere! Went here with my best friend from college and the waitress was so sweet and accommodating. It was very cold outside and we got hot toddys. My new favorite bar in the financial district!
author: Camille E.

description: Great place for a small group for happy hour (Monday-Friday 3pm -7pm). I had a twisted berry cocktail which was very good. And by good, I mean it was strong but I didn't taste the alcohol. Price was around $8, which I think is good for what I got. They have a small selection of bottled beer, beer on tap, wines, but I'm glad I tried a cocktail. It added to the experience...topsy totally describes the place, bar stools and all.
author: Megan K.

description: Ali is the most gracious bartender I've met.  There was also a live band with great jazz and it was amazing!!! Every Monday & Wednesday !
author: Lisa C.

description:
This place has a nice atmosphere but the service was very rough. It could just be because they are new but ordering a drink takes around 30 minutes from the waitress and it wasn't even that busy.  On 3 rounds not one was what we had ordered and was missing at least one drink.

On top of this they never apologized.  This was the worst service I've ever had and I've been to a lot of bars.  The drink were tasty but with all the ice you only get about 3 good sips and very weak pours.

Skip this place.
author: Ryder M.

description: Awesome service.  Love the friendly young lady who was bar tending.  I forgot her name but she has a beautiful accent like Russian or somewhere from Central Europe.  It was clean and the beer was ice cold.
author: Jean C.

description:
I'm not a drinker, I only like trying some and then that's pretty much it, but a review for this place doesn't hurt. After all they deserve some attention for great service and great drinks!

_______
The Service:
Wonderful wonderful wonderful. Although I must say I felt a bit sorry that the lovely lady bartender had to deal with many drunk men trying to touch her while she was doing her work. Very disrespectful and rude. So if you see any comments or reviews about the women being bad or the b word, just question it. 

Because the bartenders there are very serious about their work and executing it so people can get their drinks on time, but from what I've seen they have a great reputation here in the financial district. I see the bartenders talk with some guests as if they're friends! Now that's how you know their service is well-known to be good. Good bonds with customers.


_______
The Atmosphere:
The decorations are a bit interesting and creepy...there's boxes of old clown/circus like things looming over in a dark room held back by some sort of net or barrier. A bit strange if you ask me, but it's subtle details.

It's also a little bit tight in their too. I feel like I'm stuck in some sort of hallway with other people. Expect people to come to this bar after work too and gossip about co-workers or something like that. Some folks come to just hang out too. I've seen people bring their dates here as well. 

It's a nice dark atmosphere like I see most bars. Candle lit and whatnot. There's outdoor seating too if you'd like that but just be careful for the usual SF bums.


_______
The Beverages/Food:
My review for this is going to be very short. Let's just put it this way.
1. I usually never order foods from bars.
2. I don't drink a lot. In fact I HATE alcoholic beverages so it would be VERY unfair of my inexperienced and ignorant tastes on alcohol to judge this place.

I will say though, that watching the bartenders make drinks is like watching a beautifully well crafted water paint happen. It's so quick yet they're so good with it that everything seems well mixed. Judging from body language, facial expression and extremely unfinished almost-full dickelberry drink, the bartender knew that I wasn't into alcoholic drinks, so she whipped up a really nice drink for me...I don't know the name of it but it was a wonderful mix of berries and the basil really covered up the alcohol in it. 


_______
Other Comments: 
It's not an extremely wonderful awesome place, but it's great! I recommend anyone bringing anyone here (co-workers, family, date, friend, etc) if they just want to grab a drink after work of after hanging out in the city. I apologize for the lack of reviewing on the drinking part, but that's just who I am. Alcohol isn't my thing.


_______
Score review:
-1 star because it's nothing spectacularly mind-blowing or anything. Just decent.
+2 stars for the accommodating service
+2 stars for drinks and neat atmosphere
author: J. H.

description:
Pretty neat spot. The bar stools are like none other. They are literally giant springs that rock side to side and back and forth. You can imagine how much fun this can turn into after a couple of drinks. The ceiling has fun circus related items displayed as well. 

As far as pricing goes it's a pretty fair price. The orange juice, simple syrup, pineapple juice, etc. Is all house made. So you know the quality of what you're getting is good. 

As far as out experience goes it was wonderful. Inna was our lovely bartender who was extremely friendly and skillful in pouring our drinks. She was a pleasure. 

If you got a chance definitely go check it out.
author: Christina B.
